nodes.description: Trading 13 "high strength" items gives you enough fame for the Crimson Abyssite of Celerity quest from Rahal (A).

nodes.title: Defeat the mentioned Tier VI Jeuno (S) NMs Gaunab in Vunkerl Inlet (S).
nodes.description: Defeat the mentioned Tier VI Jeuno (S) NMs Gaunab in Vunkerl Inlet (S). Rifts are located at (F-5), (G-8), or (G-13) . Ocythoe in Grauberg (S). Rifts are located at (D-14), (G-7), or (G-11). Kalasutrax in Fort Karugo-Narugo (S). Rifts are located at (D-12), (I-11), or (K-8). Due to issues with the game crashing for some players in Fort Karugo-Narugo (S), Kalasutrax can also be spawned at (I-8), (G-9), (J-10) in present-day Beaucedine Glacier.

nodes.title: Speak to the Voidwatch Officer by the Bulwark Gate for a short cut scene and a Voidwatch Alarum.
nodes.description: Speak to the Voidwatch Officer by the Bulwark Gate for a short cut scene and a Voidwatch Alarum.

nodes.title: Examine the Bulwark Gate in Sauromugue Champaign (S) at (E-6)/(F-6) (what would be the entrance to J
nodes.description: Examine the Bulwark Gate in Sauromugue Champaign (S) at (E-6)/(F-6) (what would be the entrance to Jeuno) for a cutscene and 30,000 gil. After the cutscene the quest Between a Rock and Rift Begins automatically.

nodes.title: Obtain a Puppetmaster's Testimony from Troll Shieldbearers or Troll Surveillants in Bhaflau Thickets
nodes.description: Obtain a Puppetmaster's Testimony from Troll Shieldbearers or Troll Surveillants in Bhaflau Thickets or Troll Engravers in Halvung.

nodes.title: Talk to Shamarhaan (F-9) in Bastok Markets before trading your testimony.
nodes.description: Talk to Shamarhaan (F-9) in Bastok Markets before trading your testimony.

nodes.title: Trade the testimony to Shamarhaan (F-9) in Bastok Markets.
nodes.description: Trade the testimony to Shamarhaan (F-9) in Bastok Markets.

nodes.title: Following a cutscene, you will then be transported to the Navukgo Execution Chamber to enter a solo
nodes.description: Following a cutscene, you will then be transported to the Navukgo Execution Chamber to enter a solo BCNM battle. Proceed to the Decorative Bronze Gate and trade the testimony to enter the BCNM battle.

nodes.title: As with Maat fights, this quest is optional if you have attained a level 75 limit on another job.
nodes.description: As with Maat fights, this quest is optional if you have attained a level 75 limit on another job.

nodes.title: This fight is easily solo'd by any level 99 job.
nodes.description: This fight is easily solo'd by any level 99 job.

nodes.title: Speak to Gantineux at Windurst Waters, North (E-10) inside the Hostel above Rarab Tail Hostelry to o
nodes.description: Speak to Gantineux at Windurst Waters, North (E-10) inside the Hostel above Rarab Tail Hostelry to obtain some Spirit Incense.

nodes.title: Travel to The Eldieme Necropolis.
nodes.description: Travel to The Eldieme Necropolis

nodes.title: Inside The Eldieme Necropolis, there is a ??? that spawns on a Brazier in one of four locations.
nodes.description: Inside The Eldieme Necropolis, there is a ??? that spawns on a Brazier in one of four locations. The map to the right displays the location of each ???. The braziers at The Eldieme Necropolis, Map 2 (I-10), (I-7), and (M-6) are accessible from the Batallia Downs (G-7), top of (H-8), and (I-7). It is not necessary to enter the Batallia Downs via the "main" entrance. The point at The Eldieme Necropolis, Map 2 (D-5) is only accessible from the Batallia Downs (F-5), reachable via Beaucedine Glacier. You can also access the northwest cliff without going through Beaucedine Glacier after talking to the Lycopodium at (F-6) in Batallia Downs (S). After talking to the Lycopodium, you can then trade a flower to the shining spot at (F-6) in present-day Batallia Downs to be transported to the top of the ledge. When someone lights the Spirit Incense, the ??? spawns in a new location.

nodes.title: Touch the ??? to receive a message.
nodes.description: Touch the ??? to receive a message. Either: "The spirit incense emits a putrid odor and burns up. Your attempt this time has failed." In very rare cases, "The Spirit Incense burns brightly and the attempt succeeds". This has no effect on the outcome of the quest.

nodes.title: Return to Gantineux to receive Gantineux's Letter.
nodes.description: Return to Gantineux to receive Gantineux's Letter.

nodes.title: Head to Northern San d'Oria and deliver the letter to Eperdur, upstairs in the Cathedral Northern Sa
nodes.description: Head to Northern San d'Oria and deliver the letter to Eperdur, upstairs in the Cathedral Northern San d'Oria (M-7), for your reward.

nodes.title: This quest simply marks the end of the Voidwatch storyline and cannot be completed.
nodes.description: This quest simply marks the end of the Voidwatch storyline and cannot be completed.

nodes.title: Talk to Silver Owl at Camp Hope (Conflux #3) to accept the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Silver Owl at Camp Hope (Conflux #3) to accept the quest.

nodes.title: He asks you obtain a Pinch of moist Dangruf sulfur from a Sturdy Pyxis.
nodes.description: He asks you obtain a Pinch of moist Dangruf sulfur from a Sturdy Pyxis.

nodes.title: Talk to Vilatroire in the Watchtower, accessed from Northern San d'Oria (C-7), as a level 10+ job.
nodes.description: Talk to Vilatroire in the Watchtower, accessed from Northern San d'Oria (C-7), as a level 10+ job.

nodes.title: Form a party of 2 people with the same job, then talk to him again to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Form a party of 2 people with the same job, then talk to him again to complete the quest. All party members must be in the Watchtower area. You can start this quest with any job level 10+, and then change to a job under level 10 and still complete the quest.

nodes.title: Head to Aht Urhgan Whitegate and approach the Shararat Teahouse at (J-12) as Corsair after completin
nodes.description: Head to Aht Urhgan Whitegate and approach the Shararat Teahouse at (J-12) as Corsair after completing Navigating the Unfriendly Seas for a cutscene with Zweeha and a Life float. This key item grants you access to a 6-person battlefield. If you fail the battle, you lose your Life float and you must obtain another. You can only obtain one key item per real life day. You must wait until after Japanese Midnight to obtain another. Speak to Ratihb (J-12) Aht Urhgan Whitegate to obtain another Life float

nodes.title: From this point on Corsair does not need to be your main job.
nodes.description: From this point on Corsair does not need to be your main job.

nodes.title: Next you must go to The Ashu Talif.
nodes.description: Next you must go to The Ashu Talif. The easiest way is through Nyzul Isle Staging Point. Alzadaal Undersea Ruins Go through the Alzadaal Undersea Ruins to the teleporter at (G-8) (the one the leads to Arrapago Remnants). Then, take the right teleporter (west one) and zone out into Caedarva Mire on Dvucca Isle. This staging point is a bit safer than the Dvucca Isle Staging Point due to there being no aggro in the Alzadaal Undersea Ruins, and once in Caedarva Mire, you only need Sneak and to avoid using Job Abilities and Weapon Skills around the Ephramadian Shades.

nodes.title: In Caedarva Mire on Dvucca Isle, run straight to the entrance of Arrapago Reef at (F-9/G-9) (entranc
nodes.description: In Caedarva Mire on Dvucca Isle, run straight to the entrance of Arrapago Reef at (F-9/G-9) (entrance 3 on the map). If using a mount, don't ride until after you're interacted with the guard.

nodes.title: Once in Arrapago Reef, go straight and to the right.
nodes.description: Once in Arrapago Reef, go straight and to the right. You will see a ship on your left (H-8). Approach it for a cutscene.

nodes.title: After the cutscene, board the ship.
nodes.description: After the cutscene, board the ship. When ready, click the "Cutter" to enter the The Ashu Talif and begin the battle. You have time to buff and rest before engaging Yazquhl and Gowam. This fight has a 30 minute time limit. The fight is capped at 99. Buffs wear upon entry. Up to 6 players are allowed (including Trusts).

nodes.title: You face a Hume Warrior named Yazquhl and a Galka Blue Mage named Gowam.
nodes.description: You face a Hume Warrior named Yazquhl and a Galka Blue Mage named Gowam. Both opponents are HIGHLY resistant to Sleep and Silence, even with the use of Elemental Seal. Lullaby may work. Yazquhl and Gowam may share hate. You can kite one and kill one; however, if a kiting pet or player comes too close, the kiter may draw aggro. For example, during one fight Yazquhl turned on Carbuncle and used a weaponskill while it was kiting Gowam. Carbuncle had done nothing to draw aggro (no AoE blood pacts were used). Susceptible to Gravity and Bind. Their elemental weaponskills ignore shadows. This includes Red Lotus Blade , Burning Blade , Seraph Blade , and Shining Blade. Circle Blade erases shadows. Yazquhl uses Mighty Strikes at about 50-60% HP. Gowam uses Azure Lore at 50% HP and begin to spam spells, but he is easily interrupted with regular hits or Stun. They skillchain together so if you decide to take on both at once beware. Keep them apart. (see testimonials)

nodes.title: After the battle, you'll be ejected to (H-11) at Arrapago Reef, where you immediately receive a cuts
nodes.description: After the battle, you'll be ejected to (H-11) at Arrapago Reef, where you immediately receive a cutscene and your Corsair's Tricorne. If you cannot obtain your reward due to full inventory, just head back to the ship at (H-8). The ending cutscene play agains, and you get your hat.

nodes.title: Talk to Paytah who is at the pier near the shopping piers (I-7).
nodes.description: Talk to Paytah who is at the pier near the shopping piers (I-7). He tells you that his father's favorite cap has been lost to a gust of wind and has been blown into the water.

nodes.title: Fish the Ripped Cap out of the water and trade it to Paytah, who asks you to find someone who can re
nodes.description: Fish the Ripped Cap out of the water and trade it to Paytah, who asks you to find someone who can repair it.

nodes.title: Go to Baren-Moren in Windurst Waters South (H-7), and trade the Ripped Cap to him.
nodes.description: Go to Baren-Moren in Windurst Waters South (H-7), and trade the Ripped Cap to him.

nodes.title: Baren-Moren requires 4 Dhalmel Hides to fix the cap.
nodes.description: Baren-Moren requires 4 Dhalmel Hides to fix the cap.

nodes.title: Dhalmel hides can be found on Dhalmels.
nodes.description: Dhalmel hides can be found on Dhalmels. Nearby Dhalmels are Wild Dhalmel in Tahrongi Canyon or Bull Dhalmels in Buburimu Peninsula.

nodes.title: Trade the hides to Baren-Moren who not only repairs the cap, but he has plenty of material left over
nodes.description: Trade the hides to Baren-Moren who not only repairs the cap, but he has plenty of material left over to make you a Dhalmel Mantle.

nodes.title: Return the repaired cap to Paytah, who is so pleased he happily turns over a Leather Ring he doesn't
nodes.description: Return the repaired cap to Paytah, who is so pleased he happily turns over a Leather Ring he doesn't need.

nodes.title: Marin wants you to watch over her brother Ken in Dangruf Wadi.
nodes.description: Marin wants you to watch over her brother Ken in Dangruf Wadi.

nodes.title: When Ken asks you not to interfere, select "I wasn't talking to you, squirt!" to start the quest.
nodes.description: When Ken asks you not to interfere, select "I wasn't talking to you, squirt!" to start the quest.

nodes.title: Zone into Dangruf Wadi for a cut scene in which Ken tells you to leave.
nodes.description: Zone into Dangruf Wadi for a cut scene in which Ken tells you to leave.

nodes.title: Talk to Ken to start the escort.
nodes.description: Talk to Ken to start the escort. Talking to Ken caps the level of all players of the party to level 10. Follow him without being seen and keep him alive. He has extremely large sight range and pivots around very quickly. See notes below for tips and suggestions. He more or less follows the path outlined in the 'Quest Route' map. Ken fights all monsters he sees (even nonaggressive ones) and takes tremendous damage during the trip.

nodes.title: Once he's back at the zone he'll say something and zone out.
nodes.description: Once he's back at the zone he'll say something and zone out. That's when Marin will appear.

nodes.title: Talk to Marin to obtain Ken's escort reward and to remove your level cap.
nodes.description: Talk to Marin to obtain Ken's escort reward and to remove your level cap.

nodes.title: Go back to Bastok and talk to Marin to receive your reward, 1500 gil.
nodes.description: Go back to Bastok and talk to Marin to receive your reward, 1500 gil.

nodes.title: Speak to Chululu to receive 5 copies of a random Tarut card.
nodes.description: Speak to Chululu to receive 5 copies of a random Tarut card.

nodes.title: Trade with other players to obtain one card of each type.
nodes.description: Trade with other players to obtain one card of each type. The cards can also be purchased from players' bazaars.

nodes.title: Trade the four different cards to Chululu to receive 600 gil.
nodes.description: Trade the four different cards to Chululu to receive 600 gil.

nodes.title: Chululu will distribute more cards to a player after one day (Earth time).
nodes.description: Chululu will distribute more cards to a player after one day (Earth time).

missions.title: All the Way to the Bank

nodes.title: Speak to Peladi Shalmohr at the Mummers' Coalition in Western Adoulin to begin the quest and receive
nodes.description: Speak to Peladi Shalmohr at the Mummers' Coalition in Western Adoulin to begin the quest and receive a Tarutaru Sauce invoice.

nodes.title: NOTE: It's possible but STRONGLY ENCOURAGED NOT to bypass paying the vendors.
nodes.description: NOTE: It's possible but STRONGLY ENCOURAGED NOT to bypass paying the vendors. The means to do so is obviously a leftover developer shortcut, so it may cause future complications. See below for details. You still have to complete the hat guessing game if you pay the vendors.

nodes.title: Travel to each of the vendors listed in the invoice and pay off Tarutaru Sauce's debt by trading the
nodes.description: Travel to each of the vendors listed in the invoice and pay off Tarutaru Sauce's debt by trading the vendors the amount of gil owed. Bakery: 19,440 Defliaa Western Adoulin I-11 Sweets Shop: 3,000 Hujette Western Adoulin H-9 Cafeteria: 5,600 Flapano Western Adoulin I-8 Cafe des Larnes: 4,560 Bernegeois Eastern Adoulin G-8 Fishmonger's Stall: 6,832 Malgrom Eastern Adoulin E-8

nodes.title: After paying all the vendors off, you obtain the Tarutaru Sauce receipt.
nodes.description: After paying all the vendors off, you obtain the Tarutaru Sauce receipt.

nodes.title: Return to Peladi Shalmohr at the Mummers' Coalition for a CS.
nodes.description: Return to Peladi Shalmohr at the Mummers' Coalition for a CS.

nodes.title: Next go to (J-11) and touch the Mischief Marker for a CS.
nodes.description: Next go to (J-11) and touch the Mischief Marker for a CS. To bypass paying the tab, trade 1 gil to the marker. After the screen fades out, trade 2 gil to the marker to activate the CS.

nodes.title: During the CS, you select hats for Tuffle-Buffle to wear so that he can trick Minnifi Delqabba into
nodes.description: During the CS, you select hats for Tuffle-Buffle to wear so that he can trick Minnifi Delqabba into giving out a free sample of food. You must successfully trick Minnifi Delqabba five times to complete the quest. There are five types of hats: Costume:Ahriman cap, Egg helm, Pumpkin head, Snow bunny hat, Snowman cap Beastman:Goblin coif, Orc helm, Qiqirn hood, Quadav barbut, Yagudo Headgear Heavy:Gorney morion, Karieyh morion, Ogier's helm, Perle salade, Phorcys salade Medium:Athos's chapeau, Aurore beret, Shneddick chapeau, Thaumas hat, Thurandaut chapeau Light: Nares cap, Orvail corona, Rubeus bandeau, Teal chapeau, Weatherspoon corona To successfully trick the Mithra, you must choose a type (among the list above) you haven't chosen before, and it must be at least two places from your previous choice. For example: 1, 3, 5, 2, 4. Example: Egg helm, Perle salade, Teal chapeau, Quadav barbut, Thaumas hat If you choose incorrectly and your disguise fails to fool Minnifi Delqabba, you must get Tuffle-Buffle a random food item which can be obtained from one of the vendors listed above. If you're unsure where to go to get the item you can click on the Mischief Marker again and it will tell you where to go to get it (ex. Bakery).

nodes.title: Upon completion of the minigame, the quest is instantly completed and you receive 1000 EXP/limit poi
nodes.description: Upon completion of the minigame, the quest is instantly completed and you receive 1000 EXP/limit points. Additionally, your management skill increases by 0.2! If you chose not to pay the tab, the Tarutaru Sauce invoice stays in your inventory permanently and you cannot do the following steps.

nodes.title: After finishing the minigame, you can trade a Bowl of Vegetable Gruel to Westerly Breeze (I-5) at th
nodes.description: After finishing the minigame, you can trade a Bowl of Vegetable Gruel to Westerly Breeze (I-5) at the Waterfront to obtain 19716 gil.

nodes.title: Alternatively, you can trade a bowl of Medicinal Gruel to obtain 39432 gil (double the amount from t
nodes.description: Alternatively, you can trade a bowl of Medicinal Gruel to obtain 39432 gil (double the amount from trading Vegetable Gruel).

nodes.title: Bastok Mines Talk to Virnage at Bastok Mines (H-5) in the back room of the Bat's Lair Inn.
nodes.description: Bastok Mines Talk to Virnage at Bastok Mines (H-5) in the back room of the Bat's Lair Inn. He mentions paint from the Great War in Garlaige Citadel.

nodes.title: Garlaige Citadel.
nodes.description: Garlaige Citadel. The ??? spawns in the corner of a room at either (H-8) or (G-8) (room closest to the H-8 path) Garlaige Citadel (H-8). There may be sparkles for the ???. Click on it to obtain a Bucket of Divine Paint. WARNING! Try not to fall down the various holes on the floor! At (G-8) in a nearby room is another ??? that gives you Pouch of weighted stones, which is used to open the Banishing Gates when playing solo. If you find these, you're in the wrong room.

nodes.title: Bastok Mines Return to Virnage to receive a Letter from Virnage.
nodes.description: Bastok Mines Return to Virnage to receive a Letter from Virnage.

nodes.title: Northern San d'Oria Bring the letter to Eperdur upstairs in Northern San d'Oria's Cathedral Northern
nodes.description: Northern San d'Oria Bring the letter to Eperdur upstairs in Northern San d'Oria's Cathedral Northern San d'Oria (M-7) for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk with Yoran-Oran in the base camp.
nodes.description: Talk with Yoran-Oran in the base camp. You may talk to Jakaka at (I-10) to learn more about where Rockhoppers may be located. This is not required to continue with the quest.

nodes.title: Head to (I-10) near the south wall.
nodes.description: Head to (I-10) near the south wall. You will find a patch of grass and bones with many Ignis Eruca around the area. They detect by sound during the day so make sure you have a form of sneak up while performing this. Stand inside the triangle formed by bones in the corner.

nodes.title: Perform a /clap emote and quickly tab around.
nodes.description: Perform a /clap emote and quickly tab around. If you find a Rockhopper target, click it quickly. If you take too long, it will disappear. The Rockhopper moves around small amounts, so it's best to just stand in one spot and clap until it works. You will see a small sparkle on the ground when it appears. I suggest NOT tabbing around, but rather to set the camera to as much of bird's eye view as possible, and to look for the sparkle of the Rockhopper on the ground. You must be fairly close to the spot to get the Rockhopper, else you will get a "Target out of range." message. Walking around while clapping is a viable strategy, but you must spot and click the Rockhopper target quickly. "/clap motion" does work to draw out the Rockhopper. As this is a fairly popular experience spot, consider macroing this instead of just using /clap. typing /clap and using the up key is of course more than fast enough. Clap fast, no time to lose.

nodes.title: Return to Yoran-Oran to receive a Phial of counteragent.
nodes.description: Return to Yoran-Oran to receive a Phial of counteragent.

nodes.title: Find a Gasponia and check it (near Veridical Conflux #04).
nodes.description: Find a Gasponia and check it (near Veridical Conflux #04). If you receive the message "This gasponia is exuding a pleasantly mild scent", you must find another gasponia to inject as the current one you are at has been recently injected. The correct message is "You inject the phial of counteragent into the stalk of the gasponia.".

nodes.title: Return to Yoran-Oran for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Yoran-Oran for your reward.

nodes.title: Enter the Qulun Dome through H-7 in Beadeaux for a cutscene with Raptorlegs Gedwad to start the ques
nodes.description: Enter the Qulun Dome through H-7 in Beadeaux for a cutscene with Raptorlegs Gedwad to start the quest. You will be given the option of whether or not to begin the quest; if you choose to not take the quest, you will not be given the chance to start it again until the next Conquest Tally.

nodes.title: Talk to Waoud and agree to his divination.
nodes.description: Talk to Waoud and agree to his divination.

nodes.title: Make sure you have at least 1000 gil on you (or he wont even let you answer his questions).
nodes.description: Make sure you have at least 1000 gil on you (or he wont even let you answer his questions).

nodes.title: Answer a series of questions (see below).
nodes.description: Answer a series of questions (see below).

nodes.title: If you fail, he charges you 1000 Gil.
nodes.description: If you fail, he charges you 1000 Gil. You have to wait until the next Vanadiel day to try again. There are several different outcomes, depending on your answer: Skyserpent: "I see the symbol of the Skyserpent. It suggests spending some time away from battle. For a change of pace, why not try your hand at harvesting in the Wajaom Woodlands or Bhaflau Thickets? You may make an unexpected discovery." Flameserpent: "I see the symbol of the Flameserpent. It suggests you take an aggressive stance and not shy away from a challenge. Perhaps you might try visiting the Commission Agency. A substantial reward could be yours for the taking." Galeserpent: "I see the symbol of the Galeserpent. It suggests a loss in the near future... Even I cannot predict what this loss may entail.You would do well to pay close attention to your possessions." Stoneserpent: "I see the symbol of the Stoneserpent. It suggests you will receive a boon from the earth. A boon from the earth...? Ah yes, a stint at mining may prove beneficial. All signs point towards Mount Zhayolm..." Springserpent: "I see the symbol of the Springserpent. It suggests a sojourn to the sea. Yes, a tranquil journey on the waves. Replace your weapon with a fishing pole and fate will smile upon you."

nodes.title: If you succeed, Waoud will mention all 5 serpents, thus starting the quest: "Sky, Flame, Gale, Stone
nodes.description: If you succeed, Waoud will mention all 5 serpents, thus starting the quest: "Sky, Flame, Gale, Stone, and Spring. I see all five serpent symbols... This sign heralds a turning point in your destiny." If you somehow get disconnected before paying the 1000 gil (if you fail), when you get back you can start all over without having to wait one game day to try again.

nodes.title: Waoud will then mention one of the following three items:.
nodes.description: Waoud will then mention one of the following three items:

nodes.title: Talk to Abelard (G-9, Mayor's House) in Selbina to receive some Selbina Clay.
nodes.description: Talk to Abelard (G-9, Mayor's House) in Selbina to receive some Selbina Clay.

nodes.title: Trade the Selbina Clay to a Stone Monument to receive a Clay Tablet.
nodes.description: Trade the Selbina Clay to a Stone Monument to receive a Clay Tablet.

nodes.title: Return to Abelard and trade the Clay Tablet to him.
nodes.description: Return to Abelard and trade the Clay Tablet to him.

nodes.title: Abelard will stop accepting the Clay Tablets once you start the Rhapsodies of Vana'diel Set Free que
nodes.description: Abelard will stop accepting the Clay Tablets once you start the Rhapsodies of Vana'diel Set Free quest. You'll need to turn in the three Bee Pollen requested items to continue with this quest.

nodes.title: Repeat for the remaining Stone Monuments.
nodes.description: Repeat for the remaining Stone Monuments. You will receive the Crawler's Nest map after completing monuments #1-#15 (all but Sauromugue Champaign and Batallia Downs). The order in which you complete them does not matter. If you turn in Sauromugue and/or Batallia before finishing all of the rest, you will not get the map upon your 15th monument. You only get the map after finishing all the non-Batallia/Sauromugue monuments. Speaking to Abelard any time after receiving Selbina Clay, but before trading a Clay Tablet, triggers a hint. He mentions not receiving a tablet from any area you have not yet brought him one from. This is a good way to keep track of monuments without a checklist. While there is a Stone Monument in Fort Karugo-Narugo (S), it is not tied to this quest; trading Selbina Clay to it will not give you a Clay Tablet.

nodes.title: Talk to Curilla (A) after completing Lost Memories and obtaining the Vial of lambent potion.
nodes.description: Talk to Curilla (A) after completing Lost Memories and obtaining the Vial of lambent potion.

nodes.title: Spawn Lugarhoo by having one member of your alliance trade a Filthy Gnole Claw to the ??? at the bor
nodes.description: Spawn Lugarhoo by having one member of your alliance trade a Filthy Gnole Claw to the ??? at the border of (G-11) and (H-11). Filthy Gnole Claws can be obtained by defeating the nearby Luisons west of Conflux #5 or bought from the Auction House. They are , so a player can only possess one at a time.

nodes.title: Defeat Lugarhoo.
nodes.description: Defeat Lugarhoo. All alliance members with the quest active will obtain Lugarhoo's eyeball.

nodes.title: Speak to Curilla (A) again to finish the quest.
nodes.description: Speak to Curilla (A) again to finish the quest.

nodes.title: This is the first of several quests specifically involved in the upgrade of Mythic Weapons.
nodes.description: This is the first of several quests specifically involved in the upgrade of Mythic Weapons.

nodes.title: After receiving Captain Wildcat Badge walk into Salaheem's Sentinels.
nodes.description: After receiving Captain Wildcat Badge walk into Salaheem's Sentinels. The quest cutscene will begin when you reach the second ramp.

nodes.title: Obtain a Runic Key and a Vigil Weapon dropped from any NM in Nyzul Isle Investigation, and then trad
nodes.description: Obtain a Runic Key and a Vigil Weapon dropped from any NM in Nyzul Isle Investigation, and then trade the Nyzul Weapon of your choice to Abquhbah. Trade the weapon you want to do the Mythic weapon quest for. Abquhbah refuses to accept weapons if you do not possess a Runic Key. If you have previously completed a Mythic weapon, you must first receive your original weapon back from Abquhbah. It sounds scary, but it's okay, you already finished it.

nodes.title: You receive three objectives, requiring that you defeat or already have defeated certain Notorious M
nodes.description: You receive three objectives, requiring that you defeat or already have defeated certain Notorious Monsters: To Purge a Beastking To Demolish a Chariot To Banish an Archfiend Note: To receive credit for defeating these monsters, you must acquire the title.

nodes.title: Talk to Garnev at (F-8), near Veridical Conflux #00.
nodes.description: Talk to Garnev at (F-8), near Veridical Conflux #00.

nodes.title: Obtain a piece of Malachite from a Gold Sturdy Pyxis that drops from a monster.
nodes.description: Obtain a piece of Malachite from a Gold Sturdy Pyxis that drops from a monster. Standing Chests do not work. Malachite may also be obtained from certain NMs in Abyssea - Attohwa.

nodes.title: Return to Garnev and trade him the Malachite.
nodes.description: Return to Garnev and trade him the Malachite.

nodes.title: Quest will be flagged after completion of First Contact.
nodes.description: Quest will be flagged after completion of First Contact.

nodes.title: Talk to Joachim at (H-8) in Port Jeuno to complete the quest and flag the next.
nodes.description: Talk to Joachim at (H-8) in Port Jeuno to complete the quest and flag the next.

nodes.title: Examine the Cavernous Maw in North Gustaberg at (G-7) after flagging Dawn of Death.
nodes.description: Examine the Cavernous Maw in North Gustaberg at (G-7) after flagging Dawn of Death. You must have a Traverser Stone in your inventory to start the quest, or you will simply be allowed to enter with no cutscene. If you defeat Amphitrite without having the quest flagged, and then flag the quest later, you will automatically complete the quest after re-zoning.

nodes.title: Defeat the Uragnites NM Amphitrite.
nodes.description: Defeat the Uragnites NM Amphitrite.

nodes.title: Upon exiting the Cavernous Maw you will receive a cutscene and the quest will be completed.
nodes.description: Upon exiting the Cavernous Maw you will receive a cutscene and the quest will be completed.

nodes.title: Enter the Monastic Cavern through G-7 in Davoi for a cutscene with Loo Kohor to start the quest.
nodes.description: Enter the Monastic Cavern through G-7 in Davoi for a cutscene with Loo Kohor to start the quest. You will be given the option of whether or not to begin the quest; if you choose to not take the quest, you will not be given the chance to start it again until the next Conquest Tally.

nodes.title: Go to the Tanners' Guild in Southern San d'Oria and talk with Faulpie, the Leathercraft Guildmaster,
nodes.description: Go to the Tanners' Guild in Southern San d'Oria and talk with Faulpie, the Leathercraft Guildmaster, for a cutscene. Faulpie requests need a Buffalo Hide, Ram Leather, and 10,000 gil.

nodes.title: Trade the requested items and gil to Faulpie at the same time.
nodes.description: Trade the requested items and gil to Faulpie at the same time. Zone and wait until at least the next day (after 0:00 Vana'diel time) to talk to Faulpie again for a cutscene, at which point you will receive an Orc Cutting and the recipe for the Orc Helm that requires it. (Note: If you wish to receive another Orc Cutting, you can get more from Faulpie for 100,000 gil each.)

nodes.title: The Orc Cutting is used in a high skill Leathercraft recipe to craft the level 61 headwear Orc Helm,
nodes.description: The Orc Cutting is used in a high skill Leathercraft recipe to craft the level 61 headwear Orc Helm, which is required for the rest of the quest. Neither the Orc Helm nor the Orc Cutting can be sold via the Auction House.

nodes.title: Return to the Monastic Cavern through G-7 in Davoi while wearing the Orc Helm, for another cutscene
nodes.description: Return to the Monastic Cavern through G-7 in Davoi while wearing the Orc Helm, for another cutscene and to receive the Communication from Tzee Xicu.

nodes.title: Go to F-6 in the Monastic Cavern and select the Cryptexphere while wearing the Orc Helm to spawn 7 a
nodes.description: Go to F-6 in the Monastic Cavern and select the Cryptexphere while wearing the Orc Helm to spawn 7 angry Orc Notorious Monsters will arrive! The key item is not lost until the battle is won.

nodes.title: Talk to Stray Cloud in Norg for a cutscene to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Stray Cloud in Norg for a cutscene to start the quest.

nodes.title: Head towards Sea Serpent Grotto; before you zone you will receive a cutscene.
nodes.description: Head towards Sea Serpent Grotto; before you zone you will receive a cutscene.

nodes.title: Enter Sea Serpent Grotto and go to K-6, to the ??? in the open room.
nodes.description: Enter Sea Serpent Grotto and go to K-6, to the ??? in the open room.

nodes.title: Click on the ??? and an NM will appear, a Sea Monk by the name of Glyryvilu.
nodes.description: Click on the ??? and an NM will appear, a Sea Monk by the name of Glyryvilu. The main damage from it is the Cross Attack special that it does often, which can do between 300-1025 damage, which can be absorbed by shadows. It can be debuffed.

nodes.title: After the battle, click on the ??? again to receive a cut-scene and the Caliginous Blade (key item).
nodes.description: After the battle, click on the ??? again to receive a cut-scene and the Caliginous Blade (key item). Either waiting too long or zoning will cause the NM to respawn. ((See testimonials for more information)).

nodes.title: Return to Norg and talk with Stray Cloud for cutscene that completes the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Norg and talk with Stray Cloud for cutscene that completes the quest.

nodes.title: Trade a Scholar Stone to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegato
nodes.description: Trade a Scholar Stone to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator. The Scholar Stone can be obtained from the auction house (Goldsmithing materials), from mining in Cirdas Caverns, and from Reives in Cirdas Caverns.

nodes.title: Trade a Gnatbane to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator.
nodes.description: Trade a Gnatbane to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator. The Gnatbane can be obtained from the auction house (Alchemy materials), from harvesting in Foret de Hennetiel, or from Herb Seeds in Mog Garden's Garden Furrow (no fertilizer, assistants, or rank-ups needed).

nodes.title: Trade a Gelid aggregate to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition to complete this assignment.
nodes.description: Trade a Gelid aggregate to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition to complete this assignment. Gelid aggregate obtained from mining in Kamihr Drifts.

nodes.title: Trade a Wootz Ore to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator.
nodes.description: Trade a Wootz Ore to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator. The Wootz Ore can be obtained from a multitude of sources, including but not limited to the auction house (Smithing materials), Dynamis - Bastok and Dynamis - Beaucedine, Reives in Marjami Ravine, mining in Marjami Ravine, Campaign Unions from battles involving the Quadav Shieldwarriors, Abyssea chests, ANNM fights, and Habbleblix.

nodes.title: Trade a Marble Nugget to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegato
nodes.description: Trade a Marble Nugget to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator. The Marble Nugget can be obtained from the auction house (Materials->Goldsmithing), from mining in Morimar Basalt Fields, or from Colonization Reives in Morimar Basalt Fields.

nodes.title: Trade a Vanadium Ore to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition to complete this assignment.
nodes.description: Trade a Vanadium Ore to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition to complete this assignment. Vanadium Ore obtained from mining in Outer Ra'Kaznar. Vanadium Ore obtained from the Mog Garden > Garden Furrow's > Cactus Stems.

nodes.title: Trade a Guatambu Log to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator
nodes.description: Trade a Guatambu Log to the Task Delegator in the Scouts' Coalition, then talk to the Task Delegator. The Guatambu Log can be obtained from the auction house (Woodworking materials), from logging in Yorcia Weald, from Reives in Yorcia Weald, and from Arboreal Grove #3 in Mog Garden.

nodes.title: Enter the palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for another cutscene with Esha'ntarl.
nodes.description: Enter the palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for another cutscene with Esha'ntarl. You must zone out/in after completing Shadows of the Departed.

nodes.title: Enter Sealion's Den for a cutscene with Prishe.
nodes.description: Enter Sealion's Den for a cutscene with Prishe. You may receive a cutscene with Sueleen if this is your first time returning to Sealion's Den since your first visit to Al'Taieu. Zone back to Tavnazian Safehold and re-enter Sealion's Den for the correct cutscene.

nodes.title: Examine the Gate of the Gods at Grand Palace of Hu'Xzoi (H-8) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Examine the Gate of the Gods at Grand Palace of Hu'Xzoi (H-8) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Go to the Empyreal Paradox and check the Transcendental Radiance for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Go to the Empyreal Paradox and check the Transcendental Radiance for a cutscene. You may receive a cutscene for Rhapsodies of Vana'diel upon entering Empyreal Paradox. You must check the Transcendental Radiance for the correct cutscene. From the Home Point #1 to The Garden of Ru'Hmet, descend the elevator.

nodes.title: Check the Transcendental Radiance again to enter a battlefield against Eald'narche and Kam'lanaut (6
nodes.description: Check the Transcendental Radiance again to enter a battlefield against Eald'narche and Kam'lanaut (6 people, 30 min). There appears to be no Level Restriction on this battle, as neither buffs nor TP are lost upon entering. Alter Egos may be summoned once inside.

nodes.title: Because this is a quest, Experience Points ARE lost in this battlefield if you are KOed, like in Div
nodes.description: Because this is a quest, Experience Points ARE lost in this battlefield if you are KOed, like in Divine Might.

nodes.title: You must have this quest open or completed to enter the battlefield to help others.
nodes.description: You must have this quest open or completed to enter the battlefield to help others.

nodes.title: Talk to High Bear.
nodes.description: Talk to High Bear. He will ask you to collect some Watergrass and mark the positions on your map (3 in total).

nodes.title: Go to the three points and click on the Watergrass.
nodes.description: Go to the three points and click on the Watergrass. They are located around the 3 main lakes in the (E-5), (G-10), and (F-13) areas.

nodes.title: Conflux #01 is near the first lake, and Conflux #05 is directly between the second and third lakes.
nodes.description: Conflux #01 is near the first lake, and Conflux #05 is directly between the second and third lakes.

nodes.title: Return to High Bear for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to High Bear for your reward.

nodes.title: Go to the Outpost (Conflux 00) and talk to High Bear (A); he will ask you to return to the Watergras
nodes.description: Go to the Outpost (Conflux 00) and talk to High Bear (A); he will ask you to return to the Watergrass sites and observe any changes. You must wait one Vana'Diel day before flagging this quest after completing Aqua Pura.

nodes.title: Go to the three points and click on the Watergrass.
nodes.description: Go to the three points and click on the Watergrass. They are located around the 3 main lakes in the area (E-5, G-10, F-13), and take note of your observations. Note: You only need to visit at most 2 sites. Visit one and return to High Bear; all 3 options are from one site. Check that site if you haven't already and return.

nodes.title: Return to High Bear (A), who asks what you observed and gives several options.
nodes.description: Return to High Bear (A), who asks what you observed and gives several options. Choose the option that matches an observation at one of the sites. North Watergrass (E-5) (Conflux #1) "A curious yellowish powder clings to the leaves..." Yellowish powder "The massive footprints of an unidentified beast adorn the soil..." Beastly footprints "The leaves are slimy to the touch..." Slimy leaves Middle Watergrass (G-10) (Conflux #5) "The leaves are covered with beads of rainwater..." Raindrops "The leaves are coated with a thin layer of what appears to be gunpowder..." Gunpowder "A curious liquid oozes from the plant's stalk..." A curious ooze South Watergrass (F-13) (Conflux #6) "A thin layer of ash coats the leaves..." Ash-coated leaves "Foul, decaying fruit hangs from a withered branch..." Rotted fruit "The soil exudes a malodorous stench..." Malodorous soil

nodes.title: Wait for the next game day at 0:00, and return to High Bear (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Wait for the next game day at 0:00, and return to High Bear (A) for your reward. Zoning is not necessary. He does not always give you a seal. It seems that seals are no longer awarded for incorrect answers.

nodes.title: After receiving your reward, you can reaccept the quest immediately without zoning.
nodes.description: After receiving your reward, you can reaccept the quest immediately without zoning.

nodes.title: Talk to Hadahda upstairs for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Hadahda upstairs for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Collect letters: T - (F-8) Zabahf, Balhran Way, standing next to a pillar U - (F-5) Mathlouq, In the
nodes.description: Collect letters: T - (F-8) Zabahf, Balhran Way, standing next to a pillar U - (F-5) Mathlouq, In the Alchemist's Guild A - (H-6) Ekhu Pesshyadha, Port Ephramad, waters edge west of desk D - (I-5) Balakaf, Port Ephramad, east of desk, upper floor D - (H-9) Matifa, Serpentking Square, little girl at corner of fountain M - (J-8) Mhasbaf, Way of the Devout, west side, upper floor A - (K-12) Qutiba, In the Shararat Teahouse

nodes.title: Talk to Hadahda again for another cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Hadahda again for another cutscene.

nodes.title: You can choose to trade the Bowl of Sutlac to Hadahda for an Imperial Bronze Piece.
nodes.description: You can choose to trade the Bowl of Sutlac to Hadahda for an Imperial Bronze Piece.

nodes.title: Speak to Nanaa Mihgo in Windurst Woods at (J-3) for a cutscene and the three key items: Gang Whereab
nodes.description: Speak to Nanaa Mihgo in Windurst Woods at (J-3) for a cutscene and the three key items: Gang Whereabouts Note, First Forged Envelope and Second Forged Envelope. NOTE: You may have to speak with Nanaa Mihgo multiple times depending on various other quests. NOTE: If quest doesn't start when you talk to her, equip the Marauder's Knife.

nodes.title: OPTIONAL: Talk to her two consorts, Cha Lebagta and Bopa Greso who are just south of Nanaa Mihgo at
nodes.description: OPTIONAL: Talk to her two consorts, Cha Lebagta and Bopa Greso who are just south of Nanaa Mihgo at (J-4), for additional details.

nodes.title: FROM HERE ON, YOU CAN COMPLETE THE QUEST ON ANY JOB.
nodes.description: FROM HERE ON, YOU CAN COMPLETE THE QUEST ON ANY JOB. You do not have to be a Thief to continue with the remaining tasks and it does not matter which part is done first.

nodes.title: This quest is flagged right after the final cutscene in Manifest Destiny.
nodes.description: This quest is flagged right after the final cutscene in Manifest Destiny.

nodes.title: Return to the Mithran Bivouac in Meriphataud Mountains (S) (I-8) to receive a Poet god's key.
nodes.description: Return to the Mithran Bivouac in Meriphataud Mountains (S) (I-8) to receive a Poet god's key.

nodes.title: Return to Collapsing Floor at the top of Castle Oztroja (S) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Return to Collapsing Floor at the top of Castle Oztroja (S) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Click again to enter the battlefield.
nodes.description: Click again to enter the battlefield. If you fail the fight you will have to return to the Mithran Bivouac to receive a new Poet god's key. This can only be done once per game day.

nodes.title: After winning the fight, you will receive a cutscene and be placed outside the castle gates in Merip
nodes.description: After winning the fight, you will receive a cutscene and be placed outside the castle gates in Meriphataud Mountains (S).

nodes.title: Return to the Mithran Bivouac for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Return to the Mithran Bivouac for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Return to Dhea Prandoleh in Windurst Waters (S) (H-10) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Return to Dhea Prandoleh in Windurst Waters (S) (H-10) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Check the Sealed Entrance of the tower at (F-11) in West Sarutabaruta (S).
nodes.description: Check the Sealed Entrance of the tower at (F-11) in West Sarutabaruta (S).

nodes.title: NOTE: it is recommended to unload the addon fastcs if you use windower as it may cause you to discon
nodes.description: NOTE: it is recommended to unload the addon fastcs if you use windower as it may cause you to disconnect during the next cutscene. You may still disconnect when loading back into the game.

nodes.title: Zone into Windurst Waters (S) for the final cutscene and your reward.
nodes.description: Zone into Windurst Waters (S) for the final cutscene and your reward. If you have full inventory you can get your reward from Dhea Prandoleh later.

nodes.title: If you have obtained the Bundle of half-inscribed scrolls, speak to Romaa Mihgo (S) in Windurst Wate
nodes.description: If you have obtained the Bundle of half-inscribed scrolls, speak to Romaa Mihgo (S) in Windurst Waters (S) (G-11) (North) to obtain Trust: Romaa Mihgo.

nodes.title: Talk to Atelloune, standing near the fountain at (L-6) in Southern San d'Oria.
nodes.description: Talk to Atelloune, standing near the fountain at (L-6) in Southern San d'Oria. She'll tell you about a letter she received that has her irritated. She'll ask you to bring back a Ladybug Wing in answer to her letter.

nodes.title: Trade a Ladybug Wing to Atelloune, which will give her a mild shock.
nodes.description: Trade a Ladybug Wing to Atelloune, which will give her a mild shock. For your reward, she tells you why there aren't any ladybugs in the present. She'll then give you the Trainee Gloves, and tell you to leave her to her work.

nodes.title: {Ru'Lude Gardens} Maat asks you to retrieve three pieces of Frigicite from Xarcabard.
nodes.description: {Ru'Lude Gardens} Maat asks you to retrieve three pieces of Frigicite from Xarcabard. A fast way to get there is to Unity warp (Level 125 category).

nodes.title: {Xarcabard} The Frigicite are found in caves.
nodes.description: {Xarcabard} The Frigicite are found in caves. Each piece of Frigicite is guarded by a NM that has True Sight and True Hearing. Defeat each NM, and quickly run in and touch the ??? to receive the rewards (key items): You do not need to be in the party killing them to receive the "Something in the ice shifted" text and attain your reward (Just close by to check the ???). (I-6) Boreal Tiger. The reward is a Round Frigicite. (J-6) Boreal Coeurl. The reward is a Square Frigicite. (G-10) Boreal Hound. The reward is a Triangular Frigicite Due to the update on Feb 23, 2012 causing the ??? to always be present, you do not need to defeat the NMs if you run past them and click the ???. All three NM have the Draw In ability, but you might be able to use Trusts to distract them while you run out of range. Hopping off a Mount, grabbing the ???, and hopping back on can also make this easier. These NMs have fairly quick respawn rates (around 5 minutes, as in normal zone mobs). Touch the ??? quickly. If the NMs aggro you, they'll follow you for several seconds, then they'll immediately start casting a spell. Take this time to run out of their range, because if you do, they'll lose hate and they'll return to their spawn point.

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno) When job Lv71+ with axe skill Lv240+, talk to Brutus.
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno) When job Lv71+ with axe skill Lv240+, talk to Brutus. He will give you: Pick of Trials and the Weapon Training Guide (key item). Brutus will not give you the Pick of Trials if you have another Trial Weapon in your possession. Do not spam through the text. You have to choose the right answer, or he will not give you the quest and you will have to zone and speak to him again. If the quest "Chocobo on the Loose!" is active, Brutus will only give out this quest after you have talked to him a second time. Any Beastmaster quest involving Brutus, even AF3 quest, will make you unable to get this quest. Zone after completing these quests. You can, however, do the BST AF weapon quest, retrieve the guiding bell, and return here and receive the Axe of Trials.

nodes.title: Make the latent disappear: use the Pick of Trials and accumulate 300 total weapon skill points.
nodes.description: Make the latent disappear: use the Pick of Trials and accumulate 300 total weapon skill points. You must perform Weapon Skills and/or Skillchains on monsters that con Easy Prey or higher. You receive 5 points for opening/soloing a weaponskill, 7 points for closing a Lv.1 Skillchain, 9 points for closing a Lv.2 Skillchain and 11 points for closing a level 3 Skillchain. Only applies to the weapon closing the skillchain. Weapon Skills performed while under Level Sync will count. Weapon Skills performed in Reives will count. To see if you are done, check the equipment screen. You are done if you no longer receive the status enhancements by the weapon's latent effect. The text on the weapon will not change; only your physical stats.

nodes.title: {Upper Jeuno} Trade the latentless Pick of Trials back to Brutus.
nodes.description: {Upper Jeuno} Trade the latentless Pick of Trials back to Brutus. He will take the weapon and give Map to the Annals of Truth (key item) and tell you to head to Temple of Uggalepih.

nodes.title: {Yhoator Jungle} Enter the Temple of Uggalepih from point 1 on the Yhoator Jungle Map (not from Den
nodes.description: {Yhoator Jungle} Enter the Temple of Uggalepih from point 1 on the Yhoator Jungle Map (not from Den of Rancor) and kill the NM. {Uggalepih point 1} Turn North at the fork and exit to point 4. Re-enter the Uggalepih at point 5. {Uggalepih point 5} Go to G-9. Click the ??? to spawn the NM Yallery Brown. Note: Poison Potion recommended for this NM fight. AoE sleep (Slumber Powder) can be troublesome. {Uggalepih} Once the NM is dead, re-examine the ??? to obtain the Annals of Truth (key item). If you zone without re-examining the ??? you will have to fight the NM again.

nodes.title: {Upper Jeuno} Bring this key item back to Brutus for your reward.
nodes.description: {Upper Jeuno} Bring this key item back to Brutus for your reward. Optional: If you have completed A New Dawn, examine the Merchant's Door at Lower Jeuno (G-11) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house} Talk to Kaede for a cutscene.
nodes.description: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house} Talk to Kaede for a cutscene.

nodes.title: {Port Bastok F-6 Warehouse 2} Talk to Kagetora
nodes.description: {Port Bastok F-6 Warehouse 2} Talk to Kagetora upper floor, western warehouse

nodes.title: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house}Talk to Ensetsu who will ask you for a favor.
nodes.description: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house}Talk to Ensetsu who will ask you for a favor. This quest will now appear in the Bastok quests log.

nodes.title: {Korroloka Tunnel Map 5 L-8} Find a ??? that spawns three Korroloka Leeches.
nodes.description: {Korroloka Tunnel Map 5 L-8} Find a ??? that spawns three Korroloka Leeches. Kill them and click on the ??? to get some Strangely Shaped Coral If you receive the message "You see nothing out of the ordinary," simply wait for the leeches' bodies to vanish. Then you can get the coral by checking the ???. Not everyone has this issue. If more than one party member needs this fight, the leeches only need to be popped & killed once. NOTE: The player who spawned the leeches must click the ??? last. Otherwise the players who did not spawn the leeches will be unable to obtain the Strangely Shaped Coral. There are Thread Leeches nearby that link with the Korroloka Leeches. It is helpful to clear the area of the leeches before checking the ??? to avoid links. Ghosts also spawn in the area

nodes.title: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house} Talk to Ensetsu.
nodes.description: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house} Talk to Ensetsu. He tells you to take the coral to Norg.

nodes.title: {Norg H-8} Talk to Ryoma on the docks to receive a Sealed Dagger.
nodes.description: {Norg H-8} Talk to Ryoma on the docks to receive a Sealed Dagger. If this is your first trip to Norg, you will need the Airship pass for Kazham or be on the Rhapsodies of Vana'diel mission The Beginning or higher to be able to go there. Port Jeuno > Kazham > Yuhtunga Jungle > Sea Serpent Grotto (sneak/blood aggro at 30) > Norg

nodes.title: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house} Return the dagger to Ensetsu.
nodes.description: {Port Bastok J-5 northernmost house} Return the dagger to Ensetsu. This final cutscene finishes the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Khoto Rokkorah in Windurst Waters (present time) at (H-10), north map.
nodes.description: Talk to Khoto Rokkorah in Windurst Waters (present time) at (H-10), north map.

nodes.title: Travel to (H-14) in Rolanberry Fields (S) and check the Peculiar Rootprints to get a cutscene.
nodes.description: Travel to (H-14) in Rolanberry Fields (S) and check the Peculiar Rootprints to get a cutscene. The fastest way to get there is to use a Survival Guide to teleport to Rolanberry Fields (S). If using the Campaign warp, you can warp to Pashhow Marshlands (S) and zone into Rolanberry Fields (S).

nodes.title: Travel to (E-11) in North Gustaberg (S) and click on the Peculiar Rootprints.
nodes.description: Travel to (E-11) in North Gustaberg (S) and click on the Peculiar Rootprints. (Right behind where you would normally appear if you used the Campaign warp to the area).

nodes.title: Travel to Meriphataud Mountains (S), and at (L-4) you'll find another set of Peculiar Rootprints.
nodes.description: Travel to Meriphataud Mountains (S), and at (L-4) you'll find another set of Peculiar Rootprints. Clicking on them will give you an "Ending" CS. The quickest way to get there is to use a Survival Guide. Watch out for War Lynx in the vicinity. (During some point in the CS, you get three choices to pick from to choose where you think Netherstalk really is. "Above the clouds", "In the Sea", and "In the desert". Choosing a different option does not affect the quest; you will be brought back to the menu with the same three choices, and not be able to proceed unless you choose "Above the clouds."

nodes.title: Talk to Ferdechiond at the Outpost (I-9, Conflux #00); he will give you his Espionage Pearlsack and
nodes.description: Talk to Ferdechiond at the Outpost (I-9, Conflux #00); he will give you his Espionage Pearlsack and ask you to check his linkpearls at three different spots, which he marks on your map. Reward depends on your speed.

nodes.title: Go to the three points and click on the ???.
nodes.description: Go to the three points and click on the ???. They are located at (H-10, G-8, E-11).

nodes.title: Return to Ferdechiond (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Ferdechiond (A) for your reward. Ferdechiond: It took you a fair while, but I cannot be overly critical of a civilian volunteer. ==> 700 cruor 1st completion. 300 after that. (Slowest, 10+ minutes) Ferdechiond: And a fairly swift return, at that. Yeoman's work from a civilian like yourself. ==> 1000 cruor 1st completion. 600 after that. (Medium. ~8-9 minutes) Ferdechiond: Why, it seems barely a moment ago that you set off on your mission. Thorough and swift. That's what I like to see! ==> 1500 cruor 1st completion. 800 after that. (Fastest. ~7 minutes or below.)

nodes.title: Your time begins when you accept the quest and ends after you click on the third ???, NOT when you t
nodes.description: Your time begins when you accept the quest and ends after you click on the third ???, NOT when you talk to the NPC for the final time.

nodes.title: Talk to Salim to get a cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Salim to get a cutscene. He is standing on the balcony overlooking the north elevator. DO NOT ZONE after you have started the quest; if you do, it will be cancelled.

nodes.title: Next go to the Temple of the Goddess at the bottom of Metalworks (G-8) and examine the ??? on the al
nodes.description: Next go to the Temple of the Goddess at the bottom of Metalworks (G-8) and examine the ??? on the altar for a cutscene with Miledo-Shiraddo and Luto Mewrilah. After the first time through, you become "more involved" in the cutscene.

nodes.title: Choose one of seven different items to help you in the quest.
nodes.description: Choose one of seven different items to help you in the quest. Whichever you choose will determine your reward: Bard's Harp -> Prism Powder. When using it on guards, choose "Recent Happy Times" for Militant Gale, "Promotion Day" for Gentle Tiger - other results are neutral/unfavorable. The first time you play for each guard, you receive a small 10 gil reward (until you have played for both guards. You can play for the same one and get a reward as long as you haven't played for the other. -- even repeating the quest in future "cycles" does not reset this). You can play the harp with no limit - using the songs above will allow you to progress to press the switch. ??? (Costume Kit) -> Icarus Wing. The Costume Kit is revealed after completing the quest once with each of the other available options and upon completion of Chameleon Capers. -Note- Only able to be completed once unless you restart the NPC quest. Lead Guardsman's ID -> Hi-Potion Militant Gale - Used Lead Guardsman's ID Take a break - Leaves to take a break. Guard another spot - Luto Mewrilah or Miledo-Shiraddo captured. Call all guards together - Luto Mewrilah or Miledo-Shiraddo captured. How is Salim doing? - Goes away to check on Salim. Gentle Tiger - Used Lead Guardsman's ID All options are same as for Militant Gale, but you get the exact opposite results! Take a break - Luto Mewrilah or Miledo-Shiraddo captured. Guard another spot - Leaves to guard another spot. Call all guards together - Leaves to call them together. How is Salim doing? - Luto Mewrilah or Miledo-Shiraddo captured. Lucky Charm -> Key Ring Belt Pocket Watch -> Hermes Quencher Scope -> Silent Oil. Allows you to see which NPCs are safe to talk to for hints; useless if you're reading this page. Don't use on hint NPCs or you can miss out on getting one. Snare -> Hi-Ether You are given several locations in which to lay the snares. This will stop the guards from even challenging your attempts to press the switches, should you place a snare at the location where a switch is. Hint: Put the snares in each of the three switch locations. The "all clear" will be automatic each time you press a switch. The snares cannot be deactivated throughout the quest.

nodes.title: You must examine three switches in the Metalworks a total of 3-10 times, in random order.
nodes.description: You must examine three switches in the Metalworks a total of 3-10 times, in random order. (e.g., MLSLLSMS, SLMMMSLL, LMSSSMLM, or other random combinations.) Switch locations: The small switch ("hardest to find") is in the Cermet Refinery (G-7), underneath a shelf, and north of the elevators. The medium (or "normal") switch is at the replica (G-8) near the entrance, next to NPC Quasim. The large switch ("hardest to use") is at the kiln (F-8) just outside of the Blacksmithing Guild. There are 5 NPCs who will give you hints to the order in which the switches must be deactivated. The nature of the specific hints will vary, but as long as you talk to them, you'll be told everything you need to know. The NPCs are: Folzen (In corridor leading to Blacksmith Guild) Darha (North side of open area just outside Blacksmith Guild) Helmut (Middle of elevators room) Hungry Wolf (Craftsmen's Eatery, Upper Floor) Striking Snake (Gunpowder Room, Upper Floor)

nodes.title: At each switch, you will encounter a different guard.
nodes.description: At each switch, you will encounter a different guard. You will be given a choice of four options to deal with them. Gentle Tiger: If it is this Galka, choose either... "Leave it to Luto Mewrilah", or... "Say something clever" and then choose "Checking out the Metalworks." Militant Gale: If it is this Galka, choose either... "Leave it to Miledo-Shiraddo", or... "Say something clever" and then choose "Waiting for a friend." Pensive Beast (Appears only when the Lucky Charm is picked as the help item): If you run into the Lead Guardsman, choose... "Use the Lucky Charm." Note: If you are at the wrong switch, he will catch you no matter what. Salim (Appears in the place of the other guards when the Costume Kit is selected): When you see him... "Use the Costume Kit" and then select one of the three items (knitted cap, spectacles, silver heels). The knitted cap will transform you into Salim's son Pabro if you're a male character, or his daughter Erba if you're a female character; the spectacles will transform you into Salim's father if you're a male character, or his mother if you're a female character; and the silver heels will transform you into Salim's wife Ulrica regardless of your gender. Any of the 3 transformations will work, and there does not seem to be a limit as to how many times you can transform into the same person during the quest.

nodes.title: Once you see the message "You hear a noise from the direction of the Temple of the Goddess", go back
nodes.description: Once you see the message "You hear a noise from the direction of the Temple of the Goddess", go back to the temple and check the ??? for a final cutscene to complete the quest and receive your reward. The first time you complete this quest for any item, you will receive an extended cutscene with Miledo-Shiraddo (Nambima-Hyonbima). Salim will give you a reward based on the item you selected previously.

nodes.title: This quest can be only be done ONCE per Conquest Tally.
nodes.description: This quest can be only be done ONCE per Conquest Tally.

nodes.title: This quest is automatically flagged after completing Drafted by the Duchy.
nodes.description: This quest is automatically flagged after completing Drafted by the Duchy.

nodes.title: Defeat all of the Tier I Jeuno NMs.
nodes.description: Defeat all of the Tier I Jeuno NMs. Goji in Sauromugue Champaign at (G-6), (I-6), or (K-10). Yatagarasu in Rolanberry Fields at (E-10), (F-8), or (Intersection of F-6/7 and G-6/7). Cherufe in Batallia Downs at (G-8), (I-9), or (J-10). Gugalanna in Sauromugue Champaign (S) at (G-6), (I-6), or (K-10). Agathos in Rolanberry Fields (S) at (E-10), (F-8), or (G-7). Taweret in Batallia Downs (S) at (G-8), (I-9), or (J-10).

nodes.title: After defeating all 6 NMs return to an Atmacite Refiner to have your Stratum upgraded to a White Str
nodes.description: After defeating all 6 NMs return to an Atmacite Refiner to have your Stratum upgraded to a White Stratum Abyssite II.

nodes.title: Talk to High Bear.
nodes.description: Talk to High Bear. He will tell you "I am compiling data on the effects of Bastok's mining and industrial projects on the environment. I've heard adventurers say that the Quadav dumping of industrial waste has polluted Beadeaux and its surrounding areas. I'd like to examine some of that Corrupted Dirt. I've heard you can find some near their forges, and that it's also easier to spot on rainy days."

nodes.title: Go to Beadeaux.
nodes.description: Go to Beadeaux. Proceed straight in, then turn left (go north) when you reach the wall at F-7. Go north to the wall in F-6, then due east to H-6. From here head south and you'll find yourself going into a cave that leads down. Take that down until it exits at H-7 on the lower map.

nodes.title: From here, go west and south as you can until you come to the tunnel at F-8 that leads back to the s
nodes.description: From here, go west and south as you can until you come to the tunnel at F-8 that leads back to the surface; you will pass one Afflictor that will Curse you as you proceed. Follow the surface path along, south past the Mute at F-9. Continue south, under the bridge and past the second Afflictor, then head east around the giant smokestacks at G-9/H-9.

nodes.title: When the weather is raining, a ??? will appear near the base of the smokestacks at G-9 or H-9(see ma
nodes.description: When the weather is raining, a ??? will appear near the base of the smokestacks at G-9 or H-9(see map). Select that to receive the Corrupted Dirt (key item).

nodes.title: Return to the Metalworks and talk to High Bear to deliver the dirt and complete the quest.
nodes.description: Return to the Metalworks and talk to High Bear to deliver the dirt and complete the quest.

missions.title: Beam Me Up... No, Not There!

nodes.title: Speak to Anastase and select the invisible chat option to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Speak to Anastase and select the invisible chat option to begin the quest.

nodes.title: Select a difficulty level to receive an assigned zone.
nodes.description: Select a difficulty level to receive an assigned zone. Your target fount depends on the difficulty setting you choose (see the sections below).

nodes.title: After selecting a difficulty, you are warped to a random zone corresponding with your difficulty set
nodes.description: After selecting a difficulty, you are warped to a random zone corresponding with your difficulty setting. You appear some distance away from the zone's Geomagnetic Fount. You must return to that area's Geomagnetic Fount and examine it.

nodes.title: Return to Anastase to complete the quest and receive Trail Cookies and Conquest Points that vary in
nodes.description: Return to Anastase to complete the quest and receive Trail Cookies and Conquest Points that vary in amount depending on the location you were assigned. If you did not return to the Geomagnetic Fount in the zone you were transported to, returning to Anastase will still complete the quest, but you will only receive a single Trail Cookie as a reward. After completing this quest for the first time, the invisible option is replaced with the option "Can I give you a hand with...you know?"

nodes.title: Talk with Thierride (S) (across from Watchdog Alley) to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk with Thierride (S) (across from Watchdog Alley) to start the quest.

nodes.title: Obtain 2 Lufet Salts by defeating River Crabs in West Ronfaure at the Knightwell.
nodes.description: Obtain 2 Lufet Salts by defeating River Crabs in West Ronfaure at the Knightwell.

nodes.title: Return to Southern San d'Oria (S) and speak with Thierride.
nodes.description: Return to Southern San d'Oria (S) and speak with Thierride.

nodes.title: Trade him one Lufet Salt for a cutscene, then trade another.
nodes.description: Trade him one Lufet Salt for a cutscene, then trade another.

nodes.title: Zone before talking to him again to get your reward.
nodes.description: Zone before talking to him again to get your reward. You can use Retrace to zone and run back to Thierride.

nodes.title: Speak with Nichais at (L-7) in Southern San d'Oria (S) to trigger the initial cutscene.
nodes.description: Speak with Nichais at (L-7) in Southern San d'Oria (S) to trigger the initial cutscene.

nodes.title: Head to Grauberg (S) and examine the Timeworn Altar at (F-11) to trigger a series of cutscenes.
nodes.description: Head to Grauberg (S) and examine the Timeworn Altar at (F-11) to trigger a series of cutscenes. Route: From the Campaign tele spot, go south to J-11, then west to F-11. The altar is located at the edge of the stream heading southwest. Caution: There might be Chigoe on the way to the altar (around I-11) that can give you a nasty surprise if not expecting them. The Chigoes seem to like to hide in the grass. Goblins in this part of Grauberg seem wander around from H-11 to G-11.

nodes.title: Speak with Nichais again for a follow-up cutscene.
nodes.description: Speak with Nichais again for a follow-up cutscene.

nodes.title: Trade a Shell Bug to Nichais to trigger a cutscene.
nodes.description: Trade a Shell Bug to Nichais to trigger a cutscene.

nodes.title: Head to Grauberg (S) and examine the Timeworn Altar again to trigger the final cutscene and receive
nodes.description: Head to Grauberg (S) and examine the Timeworn Altar again to trigger the final cutscene and receive your reward.

nodes.title: As a main job Monk level 71+, talk to Vola at the Tenshodo HQ in Neptune's Spire's basement in Lower
nodes.description: As a main job Monk level 71+, talk to Vola at the Tenshodo HQ in Neptune's Spire's basement in Lower Jeuno.

nodes.title: Go through the Door: "Neptune's Spire" (J-7) for a cutscene where Atori-Tutori requests a Wyrm Beard
nodes.description: Go through the Door: "Neptune's Spire" (J-7) for a cutscene where Atori-Tutori requests a Wyrm Beard.

nodes.title: Talk to Talib at (F-6) in Port Bastok (Home Point #3) downstairs in warehouse 2 for a cutscene where
nodes.description: Talk to Talib at (F-6) in Port Bastok (Home Point #3) downstairs in warehouse 2 for a cutscene where Cornelia asks your help to get a Zinc Ore for her friend Parraggoh and hints that you can get them from monsters in Gustaberg. Accept the quest and Talib will agree to take the ore from you when you get it. If you decline the quest you can start it by talking to Parraggoh.

nodes.title: (Optional) Talk to Talib again and he explains that Cornelia is making the ore delivery for Parraggo
nodes.description: (Optional) Talk to Talib again and he explains that Cornelia is making the ore delivery for Parraggoh who was injured and can't do it himself. He also tells you where you can find Parraggoh.

nodes.title: Trade a Zinc Ore to Talib to receive the Palborough Mines Logs.
nodes.description: Trade a Zinc Ore to Talib to receive the Palborough Mines Logs.

nodes.title: Talk to Parraggoh at (H-5) in Bastok Mines (Home Point #1) inside the first house down the ramp to t
nodes.description: Talk to Parraggoh at (H-5) in Bastok Mines (Home Point #1) inside the first house down the ramp to the lower level to complete the quest.

nodes.title: (Optional) After completing The Eleventh's Hour, return to Parraggoh for additional dialoge.
nodes.description: (Optional) After completing The Eleventh's Hour, return to Parraggoh for additional dialoge.

nodes.title: Speak with Waoud and choose "Gaze away" to have him tell your fortune.
nodes.description: Speak with Waoud and choose "Gaze away" to have him tell your fortune.

nodes.title: Zone and speak to Waoud again and choose "Gaze away" as before.
nodes.description: Zone and speak to Waoud again and choose "Gaze away" as before. During the cutscene that follows, choose "I have" and you will be told to visit the five original Staging Points. You must zone before speaking to Waoud for this cutscene; otherwise he'll just repeat the original Q&A used to unlock the blue mage job. If you received the cut-scene after talking to Waoud the first time, you do not have to zone and talk to him again. If you do you will receive a little dialogue and end up paying him 1,000 gil. Be sure not to talk to him before zoning or else you will have to go through the question-and-answer cutscene you did to first unlock blue mage, and then pay him 1,000 gil. If you start down the question-and-answer path accidentally, you can disconnect/crash your client without fear of breaking the quest progression.

nodes.title: Visit each staging point and speak with the Immortal Sentry at each as Blue Mage.
nodes.description: Visit each staging point and speak with the Immortal Sentry at each as Blue Mage. They will each give you a key item "Brand." If at any time you want to know what brands you've already acquired, you can go to Permanent Key items and check them off. Brand of the Stoneserpent (Azouph Isle Staging Point) - Nareema Brand of the Galeserpent (Dvucca Isle Staging Point) - Nahshib Brand of the Skyserpent (Mamool Ja Staging Point) - Daswil Brand of the Flameserpent (Halvung Staging Point) - Waudeen Brand of the Springserpent (Ilrusi Atoll Staging Point) - Meyaada

nodes.title: Talk to Enaremand at J-7 on the upper level in the Tavnazian Safehold for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Enaremand at J-7 on the upper level in the Tavnazian Safehold for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Head to Qufim Island (F-7) (follow the Delkfutt's Tower wall south from its entrance).
nodes.description: Head to Qufim Island (F-7) (follow the Delkfutt's Tower wall south from its entrance).

nodes.title: Click on the Transcendental Radiance with a Traverser Stone in your key items.
nodes.description: Click on the Transcendental Radiance with a Traverser Stone in your key items.

nodes.title: Select "Proceed" to spend 10,000 cruor to obtain a Crimson Traverser Stone, automatically enter Abys
nodes.description: Select "Proceed" to spend 10,000 cruor to obtain a Crimson Traverser Stone, automatically enter Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox, and receive a cutscene.

nodes.title: The next quest is automatically flagged upon cutscene completion.
nodes.description: The next quest is automatically flagged upon cutscene completion.

nodes.title: Complete mission
nodes.description: Complete the mission: Beneath the Mask

nodes.title: Speak with Rukususu at the Second Encampment (F-10) (South of Vertical Conflux #07, near the top of
nodes.description: Speak with Rukususu at the Second Encampment (F-10) (South of Vertical Conflux #07, near the top of the waterfall). You must zone after completing the quest Voices from Beyond before you can flag this quest.

nodes.title: Go to the Fay Pond at F-5 via Vertical Conflux #05 and trade some Twinkle Powder to receive a Pinch
nodes.description: Go to the Fay Pond at F-5 via Vertical Conflux #05 and trade some Twinkle Powder to receive a Pinch of Pixie Dust. For first timers: it seems to always be 10 Twinkle Powder For repeats: It is strongly advised to bring multiple stacks of Twinkle Powder for this quest because it takes a large amount of powder.

nodes.title: Return to Rukususu with the key item for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Rukususu with the key item for your reward.

nodes.title: Zone into North Gustaberg (S) from Bastok Markets (S) to start the quest.
nodes.description: Zone into North Gustaberg (S) from Bastok Markets (S) to start the quest. Wolfram asks you to bring the Clump of Animal Hair to a man named Engelhart.

nodes.title: Return to Bastok Markets (S) and speak with Engelhart (K-10).
nodes.description: Return to Bastok Markets (S) and speak with Engelhart (K-10). (where Harmodios' Music Shop is located in the present). Engelhart asks you to speak with a client at the waterfall in North Gustaberg (S).

nodes.title: Exit the city and travel to the west side of North Gustaberg (S) by taking the ramp at F-9 west of t
nodes.description: Exit the city and travel to the west side of North Gustaberg (S) by taking the ramp at F-9 west of the tower to the lower area. (Note: this is near the same spot used for Lycopodium transport in the modern era.) The quickest way is to use a Survival Guide to North Gustaberg (S) if you've activated it.

nodes.title: Near the Drachenfall, on the western side of the cliff and southern side of the river at (F-8), ther
nodes.description: Near the Drachenfall, on the western side of the cliff and southern side of the river at (F-8), there is a ???. Click it for a cutscene. You are asked to pick up a Xhifhut from the goblin Leadavox.

nodes.title: Get a Gnole Claw either from the Auction House or from killing or stealing from Gnole type mobs.
nodes.description: Get a Gnole Claw either from the Auction House or from killing or stealing from Gnole type mobs. (See Notes below.)

nodes.title: Travel to Vunkerl Inlet (S) and talk to Leadavox.
nodes.description: Travel to Vunkerl Inlet (S) and talk to Leadavox. Leadavox is on Gerlvan Isle on the border of (I-6) & (J-6) behind the Cyclopean Gate. Leadavox asks you to bring her a Gnole Claw in exchange for the Xhifhut. The fastest route to Vunkerl Inlet (S) is to use the Survival Guide north of the waterfall (F-7) to travel to Batallia Downs (S). Zone into Jugner Forest (S), and then follow the left wall to zone into Vunkerl Inlet (S). Or use the Campaign Arbiter teleport to Vunkerl Inlet (S).

nodes.title: Trade Leadavox the Gnole Claw for the Xhifhut.
nodes.description: Trade Leadavox the Gnole Claw for the Xhifhut. Optional: Consider activating the Survival Guide in the west part of the map. This will save some running on the way to San d'Oria (which you'd be visiting during the mission line, even if it is not your chosen nation of allegiance).

nodes.title: Return to Bastok Markets (S) and speak with Engelhart (K-10) again to complete this quest.
nodes.description: Return to Bastok Markets (S) and speak with Engelhart (K-10) again to complete this quest. During this Cutscene you will receive a Warning Letter.

nodes.title: If you have just completed For the Birds, zone out and zone in before speaking to Koblakiq.
nodes.description: If you have just completed For the Birds, zone out and zone in before speaking to Koblakiq.

nodes.title: Talk to Koblakiq and agree to help her to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Koblakiq and agree to help her to start the quest.

nodes.title: Go to Castle Zvahl Baileys and obtain a Demon Pen from the Blood Demon or Demon General mobs there.
nodes.description: Go to Castle Zvahl Baileys and obtain a Demon Pen from the Blood Demon or Demon General mobs there.

nodes.title: Return to Oldton Movalpolos and deliver the Demon Pen to Koblakiq.
nodes.description: Return to Oldton Movalpolos and deliver the Demon Pen to Koblakiq.

nodes.title: Wait until the next Earth day (midnight in Japan) and talk to her again.
nodes.description: Wait until the next Earth day (midnight in Japan) and talk to her again. In July 2014 Update you no longer need to wait for midnight, max wait time is now 1 minute (earth time).

nodes.title: Return to Castle Zvahl Baileys and go to the gate behind where Dark Spark is spawned (at I-8 on the
nodes.description: Return to Castle Zvahl Baileys and go to the gate behind where Dark Spark is spawned (at I-8 on the second map.)

nodes.title: Select the ??? to spawn Marquis Andrealphus and his minions: two Demon Banneret and two Demon Secret
nodes.description: Select the ??? to spawn Marquis Andrealphus and his minions: two Demon Banneret and two Demon Secretary.

nodes.title: This quest is automatically flagged after completing A World in Flux .
nodes.description: This quest is automatically flagged after completing A World in Flux .

nodes.title: Head to Pashhow Marshlands (S) and check the Veridical Conflux at (J-9) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Head to Pashhow Marshlands (S) and check the Veridical Conflux at (J-9) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to Nomad Moogle near Maat in Ru'Lude Gardens, Select the option to accept the challenge to rece
nodes.description: Talk to Nomad Moogle near Maat in Ru'Lude Gardens, Select the option to accept the challenge to receive the Soul gem clasp(You MUST trade a Seasoning Stone to the Nomad Moogle to get the Key Item.)The Nomad Moogle then offers to Teleport you to Horlais Peak, Waughroon Shrine, Balga's Dais or Qu'Bia Arena for the fight you can also select "Nowhere yet" to do the fight later.
