Optional: Talk to Maat and he refers you to Degenhard for "training".This is a side quest for an Olde Rarab Tail, An item you can use during the fight to make things a lot easier Multiple Olde Rarab Tails can be used during the fight. Note: If you want an Olde rarab tail, you will need two Seasoning Stones for this mission, as well as a Fossilized Fang and Fossilized Bone. You will lose the one that you trade to the Nomad Moogle, and will have to farm another to trade for the Olde rarab tail. Degenhard in Bastok Markets (I-10) asks for a Seasoning Stone, a Fossilized Bone, and a Fossilized Fang (all three required). He gives you an Olde rarab tail in return. Using this item in the fight makes Atori-Tutori ??? stay still, stop attacking, and lose his damage resistance for 90 seconds. The Bare Bones quest will take priority over trading Degenhard for Olde Rarab Tails.

nodes.title: After winning the battle, you will receive a Scroll of Instant Warp .
nodes.description: After winning the battle, you will receive a Scroll of Instant Warp . Return to the Nomad Moogle for a final cutscene that increases your level cap. Since a Scroll of Instant Warp is Rare/Ex, you will get one only if you don't already have one somewhere in any storage area. After completing this quest, you gain access to Domenic's warp service in Lower Jeuno. Talk to Domenic at the Neptune's Spire Inn in Lower Jeuno (J-7) right before the door into the Tenshodo. For a fee, he can teleport you to Ghelsba Outpost, Horlais Peak, Balga's Dais, Waughroon Shrine, or Qu'Bia Arena.

nodes.title: Talk to the Nomad Moogle in Ru'Lude Gardens as a level 81+ job to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to the Nomad Moogle in Ru'Lude Gardens as a level 81+ job to start the quest.

nodes.title: Trade the Nomad Moogle ten Kindred's Crests while having five stored Merit Points for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Trade the Nomad Moogle ten Kindred's Crests while having five stored Merit Points for a cutscene. You will lose the 10 Kindred's Crests and the 5 Merit Points. You can withdraw Kindred's Crests that you have stored with Shami in Port Jeuno and use them to complete this quest. Additionally, Shemo will exchange other types of seals and crests at a rate of 3:1.

nodes.title: Speak to the Nomad Moogle again to start a minigame involving Maat and Degenhard.
nodes.description: Speak to the Nomad Moogle again to start a minigame involving Maat and Degenhard.

nodes.title: This minigame is similar to Rock, Paper, Scissors.
nodes.description: This minigame is similar to Rock, Paper, Scissors. Raging Beast (Red) beats Silent Wind (Blue) Silent Wind (Blue) beats Soaring Dragon (Green) Soaring Dragon (Green) beats Raging Beast (Red)

nodes.title: To win a round, you must give Maat a color stance that overtakes Degenhard.
nodes.description: To win a round, you must give Maat a color stance that overtakes Degenhard. After five rounds, the other will yield. If Degenhard defeats Maat, you must redo the minigame from the beginning, but you will gain a handicap for every consecutive loss. You can select "Assess the situation" to determine how close either is to winning the match. Degenhard's choice is completely random, according to a robust statistical analysis (n=102). This means that any choice is as good as any other. See Talk page for details.

nodes.title: Once you complete the minigame successfully, your level cap is increased to 90.
nodes.description: Once you complete the minigame successfully, your level cap is increased to 90.

nodes.title: Defeat Maat with Bard, Beastmaster, Black Mage, Dark Knight, Dragoon, Monk, Ninja, Paladin, Ranger,
nodes.description: Defeat Maat with Bard, Beastmaster, Black Mage, Dark Knight, Dragoon, Monk, Ninja, Paladin, Ranger, Red Mage, Samurai, Summoner, Thief, Warrior and White Mage in the quest Shattering Stars. All required jobs must be level 66+ since you can only fight Maat with a job once it is 66. You MUST talk to Maat before each fight. You must walk, take the Tenshodo warp, or Homepoint teleport to the designated battlefield for every job after your first victory.

nodes.title: Talk to Maat after defeating him the last time, for an event and to receive the reward.
nodes.description: Talk to Maat after defeating him the last time, for an event and to receive the reward. You must be on one of the 15 "Maat's Cap" jobs to get the final cutscene, regardless of its level.

nodes.title: Talk to Yazan.
nodes.description: Talk to Yazan.

nodes.title: Obtain a Sand Bat Fang, either by killing the Sand Bats that drop them in the Valkurm Dunes, or from
nodes.description: Obtain a Sand Bat Fang, either by killing the Sand Bats that drop them in the Valkurm Dunes, or from the Auction House, under Bonecraft.

nodes.title: Trade the Sand Bat Fang to Yazan to complete the quest .
nodes.description: Trade the Sand Bat Fang to Yazan to complete the quest .

nodes.title: Speak to Muzaffar to start the quest.
nodes.description: Speak to Muzaffar to start the quest.

nodes.title: He wants either four Northern Furs, four pieces of Eastern Pottery or four Southern Mummies.
nodes.description: He wants either four Northern Furs, four pieces of Eastern Pottery or four Southern Mummies. Northern Furs drop from Gigas on Qufim Island and Delkfutt's Tower. Eastern Pottery drops from Clockwork Pods in Fei'Yin or Garlaige Citadel, or Magic Pots in Delkfutt's Tower. Southern Mummies drop from Liches in Western Altepa Desert. These items may also be bought from Auction House Category: Others > Misc.

nodes.title: Trade four of any item to Muzaffar to receive a variable amount of gil.
nodes.description: Trade four of any item to Muzaffar to receive a variable amount of gil.

nodes.title: Hanaa now wants 3 Tiger Hides.
nodes.description: Hanaa now wants 3 Tiger Hides. Trade these to her for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Dauperiat (I-10) in Northern San d'Oria.
nodes.description: Talk to Dauperiat (I-10) in Northern San d'Oria. You will receive a Suspicious Envelope.

nodes.title: Talk to Halver (I-9) in Chateau d'Oraguille (I-9), who will declare the envelope a forgery.
nodes.description: Talk to Halver (I-9) in Chateau d'Oraguille (I-9), who will declare the envelope a forgery.

nodes.title: Talk to Dauperiat again.
nodes.description: Talk to Dauperiat again.

nodes.title: Trade Castle Floor Plans to Dauperiat to finish the quest and receive 900g.
nodes.description: Trade Castle Floor Plans to Dauperiat to finish the quest and receive 900g. This quest is repeatable without zoning. Castle Floor Plans drop from Orcish Serjeants in Fort Ghelsba, Yughott Grotto, and Davoi.

nodes.title: {Bastok Mines J-7}Speak with Gumbah until he gives you the cutscene that starts this quest.
nodes.description: {Bastok Mines J-7}Speak with Gumbah until he gives you the cutscene that starts this quest. upper floor, across the bridge, toward the Alchemy Guild. Make sure you check your quest log before heading to Palborough Mines. The quest Great Sword Weaponskill quest Inheritance (Ground Strike) seems to take priority over this quest, so it is important to make sure to get the correct cutscene/dialogue from Gumbah.

nodes.title: {Palborough Mines H-8 Map 3} Pull the boat lever on the 3rd floor to ride it.
nodes.description: {Palborough Mines H-8 Map 3} Pull the boat lever on the 3rd floor to ride it. Fastest way is via the Palborough Mines Home Point #1 at (H-10). Otherwise, Port Bastok > North Gustaberg (K-3) > Palborough > Head to the third floor. If you have the map for Palborough Mines, the third floor has a giant burn hole in the center. The boat is very close once you go up the elevator. This boat also takes you to Zeruhn Mines (safe zone connected to Bastok Mines).

nodes.title: {Zeruhn Mines} Receive a cutscene and the Chaosbringer Lv1 Great Sword for Warriors, Dark Knights, a
nodes.description: {Zeruhn Mines} Receive a cutscene and the Chaosbringer Lv1 Great Sword for Warriors, Dark Knights, and Rune Fencers. Anyone can pull the lever; you need only make the trip. If you drop the Chaosbringer, you may take the ferry in the Palborough Mines once more to receive another.

nodes.title: Using the Chaosbringer, kill 100 enemies.
nodes.description: Using the Chaosbringer, kill 100 enemies. It doesn't matter what you kill, as long as the sword is equipped and deals the final blow with a standard/critical melee strike. Killing with weapon skills, abilities (such as Jump), and monster suicides do not count. monster suicides: Goblins' Bomb Toss, Bombs' Self-Destruct, and Bees' Final Sting) The enemy does not have to give experience points for it to count toward the 100 total. The methods used to damage the monsters are irrelevant. Suggestions to kill monsters faster. However, the killing blow must be made with Chaosbringer: Sub BLM and use Black Magic. Use a ranged weapon. Nothing resets the kill count (other than dropping the blade); you may change areas, jobs, weapons, get K.O.'d, etc. Optional: Get another 100 kills needed for the quest Blade of Death before going to turn in the Chaosbringer for this quest. Reward: Deathbringer (Lv5 DRK Greatsword). Just keep count and make sure you get 200 kills by the stipulations noted above. Special events that may help: Harvest Festival events in real-life October: Wraith Bats spawn outside the starter nations with only 1 HP. Records of Eminence quest: "Area Kills" is helpful for keeping count.

nodes.title: {Pashhow Marshlands L-11} Zone into Beadeaux with the Chaosbringer for a cutscene to unlock Dark Kni
nodes.description: {Pashhow Marshlands L-11} Zone into Beadeaux with the Chaosbringer for a cutscene to unlock Dark Knight. You can travel to Beadeaux as ANY job, not just Warrior or Rune Fencer or Paladin. The blade does not have to be equipped; it must simply be in your inventory. The Marshlands can be reached from either top-right of Konschtat Highlands or bottom of Rolanberry Fields. You can also get the cutscene by warping to the Survival Guide.

nodes.title: Speak with Gumbah for a cutscene and to receive a Letter from Zeid.
nodes.description: Speak with Gumbah for a cutscene and to receive a Letter from Zeid.

nodes.title: You must kill another 100 enemies with Chaosbringer.
nodes.description: You must kill another 100 enemies with Chaosbringer. You need to bring the total number of kills with the Chaosbringer (from the time you first received it) up to 200. As such, kills made before activating this quest count towards the total. If you've dropped the Chaosbringer, take the ferry in the Palborough Mines once more to receive another. You will need to make 200 kills with this new weapon.

nodes.title: Once the additional 100 have been slaughtered, take Chaosbringer with you to the Gusgen Mines.
nodes.description: Once the additional 100 have been slaughtered, take Chaosbringer with you to the Gusgen Mines.

nodes.title: In the Gusgen Mines, go to the standing water at (J-7) on the first map and trade Chaosbringer to th
nodes.description: In the Gusgen Mines, go to the standing water at (J-7) on the first map and trade Chaosbringer to the ???. Beware of the NM ghost, Smothered Schmidt, that spawns here. It detects by sound so use either sneak or a silent oil if you wish to avoid it.

nodes.title: After a cutscene with Zeid, your Chaosbringer will be replaced with the new Deathbringer.
nodes.description: After a cutscene with Zeid, your Chaosbringer will be replaced with the new Deathbringer.

nodes.title: Head to Beadeaux as a Dark Knight for a cutscene with Zeid.
nodes.description: Head to Beadeaux as a Dark Knight for a cutscene with Zeid. You must zone in to Beadeaux from Pashow Marshlands to receive the cutscene. Taking the proto-waypoint warp or coming from Qulun Dome will not work. However, you can transport to the Survival Guide in Beadeaux, exit to Pashhow Marshlands, then turn around and re-enter Beadeaux to get the cutscene.

nodes.title: Change areas after completing Star Struck to be able to activate this quest.
nodes.description: Change areas after completing Star Struck to be able to activate this quest. If the Summoner artifact quest Class Reunion is active, you will not be able to receive this quest until completing it first.

nodes.title: Koru-Moru asks you to go to the Maze of Shakhrami and examine the rock you find there.
nodes.description: Koru-Moru asks you to go to the Maze of Shakhrami and examine the rock you find there.

nodes.title: Optional: You may speak with Tokaka (of the Fishermen's Guild) for a lead.
nodes.description: Optional: You may speak with Tokaka (of the Fishermen's Guild) for a lead. She will tell you to ask Yoran-Oran about it.

nodes.title: From the Maze of Shakhrami entrance, head to G-6 and take the rightward passage north.
nodes.description: From the Maze of Shakhrami entrance, head to G-6 and take the rightward passage north. You will briefly wind up on another map; follow the path back around to the south to re-enter the first map at H-6. Head due east down a one-way passage, then turn south and hug the right wall to enter a passage at J-7. This will take you back to the second map; head southwest. You will find the Fossil Rock in a dead end at F-8. When you examine it, an Ichorous Ire will appear.

nodes.title: Kill the Ichorous Ire and bring the Burnite Shell back to Koru-Moru.
nodes.description: Kill the Ichorous Ire and bring the Burnite Shell back to Koru-Moru.

nodes.title: Zone after the previous quest, then speak to Luto Mewrilah for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Zone after the previous quest, then speak to Luto Mewrilah for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Head to Neptune's Spire (Lower Jeuno, I-7) and click on the first door to the left for a cutscene wh
nodes.description: Head to Neptune's Spire (Lower Jeuno, I-7) and click on the first door to the left for a cutscene where you will be asked to find Glimmering Mica, Lunascent Log, and Mistroot to take to "Mirror Pond" in Beaucedine Glacier.

nodes.title: Zone after the previous quest, then talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8) for a cutscene that s
nodes.description: Zone after the previous quest, then talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8) for a cutscene that starts the quest.

nodes.title: Luto Mewrilah sends you to find a ??? in 1 of 3 locations (see maps to the right): Ordelle's Caves (
nodes.description: Luto Mewrilah sends you to find a ??? in 1 of 3 locations (see maps to the right): Ordelle's Caves (I-5) Ranguemont Pass (I-9) (Watch out for aggro monsters on the north side close to the Beaucedine Glacier entrance / exit. Sneak and invisible are necessary even for level 99 jobs. Korroloka Tunnel (F-9/10, 5th map with exit to Western Altepa Dessert)

nodes.title: Travel to the location and check the ??? to spawn the Metallic Slime with about 900HP and level 30.
nodes.description: Travel to the location and check the ??? to spawn the Metallic Slime with about 900HP and level 30. Your NPC will appear to fight with you and will gain EXP as normal.

nodes.title: Talk to your NPC immediately after defeating the Slime, they will say something about the Vitrallum.
nodes.description: Talk to your NPC immediately after defeating the Slime, they will say something about the Vitrallum.

nodes.title: Talk to Shantotto in Windurst Walls (K-7) who will give you the Pole of Trials and the Weapon Traini
nodes.description: Talk to Shantotto in Windurst Walls (K-7) who will give you the Pole of Trials and the Weapon Training Guide (key item).

nodes.title: Use the Pole of Trials until the latent effect disappears.
nodes.description: Use the Pole of Trials until the latent effect disappears.

nodes.title: How to remove the latent effect:.
nodes.description: How to remove the latent effect:

nodes.title: You must perform Weapon Skills and Skillchains on monsters that con Easy Prey or higher.
nodes.description: You must perform Weapon Skills and Skillchains on monsters that con Easy Prey or higher.

nodes.title: Head to Xarcabard (S).
nodes.description: Head to Xarcabard (S).

nodes.title: Go to (J-9) and examine the Animal Spoor found nearby the entrance to Beaucedine Glacier (S) for a c
nodes.description: Go to (J-9) and examine the Animal Spoor found nearby the entrance to Beaucedine Glacier (S) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Go to (I-9) and examine the Wheel Rut found to the west from the Animal Spoor, in an alcove, for ano
nodes.description: Go to (I-9) and examine the Wheel Rut found to the west from the Animal Spoor, in an alcove, for another cutscene.

nodes.title: Head back to the Animal Spoor for yet another cutscene.
nodes.description: Head back to the Animal Spoor for yet another cutscene. You will obtain the Vial of military prism powder, which is needed to enter a battlefield.

nodes.title: Go to (I-7) and examine the Forbidding Portal, northwest from the Animal Spoor, for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Go to (I-7) and examine the Forbidding Portal, northwest from the Animal Spoor, for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Examine this once again to enter the battlefield for "Blood of Heroes".
nodes.description: Examine this once again to enter the battlefield for "Blood of Heroes". If you have completed this quest, you do not need to obtain the Vial of military prism powder again in order to assist. Upon loss, you will have to pick up another Vial of military prism powder at the Animal Spoor. You can obtain only one per Vana'diel day.

nodes.title: Upon victory there will be a cutscene, afterwards return to the Wheel Rut for a cutscene and your re
nodes.description: Upon victory there will be a cutscene, afterwards return to the Wheel Rut for a cutscene and your reward.

nodes.title: Speak to Kerutoto who says that if you find a suspicious item, you should bring it to her.
nodes.description: Speak to Kerutoto who says that if you find a suspicious item, you should bring it to her. If you are eligible for the quest Waking Dreams, you cannot begin Blue Ribbon Blues until you have accepted the challenge of Diabolos. Defeating Diabolos is not necessary to start this quest; however, you may need to talk to Kerutoto twice in order to do so.

nodes.title: Talk to Roberta at Nchaa's Good Goods in Windurst Woods (H-13) (between Home Point #4 & #5) and rece
nodes.description: Talk to Roberta at Nchaa's Good Goods in Windurst Woods (H-13) (between Home Point #4 & #5) and receive a Purple Ribbon. If for some reason you'd like to keep the Purple Ribbon (for use on a job that can use it) be aware you normally lose it at the end of this quest. To keep it around, send it to yourself via the Delivery service as soon as you get it. Return to Roberta and talk with her again. She will ask if you've lost the ribbon, mention that it made its way back to her, and she'll give you another.

nodes.title: Trade the Purple Ribbon to Kerutoto in the Rhinostery in Windurst Waters (South), who will give you
nodes.description: Trade the Purple Ribbon to Kerutoto in the Rhinostery in Windurst Waters (South), who will give you 3600 gil for it and tells you she will investigate it.

nodes.title: Zone out of Windurst Waters and zone back in again.
nodes.description: Zone out of Windurst Waters and zone back in again. Talk to Kerutoto again. Kerutoto gives you the Purple Ribbon back and provides some additional guidance. If you don't have the key item Magicked astrolabe, you won't be able to solo this quest. You can get one before you leave for The Eldieme Necropolis by paying 10,000 gil to Churano-Shurano (on top of the Optistery) in Windurst Waters, North (F-8).

nodes.title: Travel to The Eldieme Necropolis from Batallia Downs (J-10).
nodes.description: Travel to The Eldieme Necropolis from Batallia Downs (J-10). The Eldieme Necropolis Survival Guide warp is the fastest method for traveling to this location. It is also suggested to set the Home Point to the one outside of the Rhinostery.

nodes.title: Upon entering the dungeon go straight until you come to a T intersection at (J-8) and take a left.
nodes.description: Upon entering the dungeon go straight until you come to a T intersection at (J-8) and take a left.

nodes.title: If you have a Magicked astrolabe skip the italized directions which are indented below this line.
nodes.description: If you have a Magicked astrolabe skip the italized directions which are indented below this line. At the intersection at (I-9) one person goes right to the gate lever (H-8) and another goes left to Shiva's Gate at (H-8). Once inside Shiva's Gate, the person at the lever has to activate it again to open Levathian's Gate (to keep heading west). Keep heading west until Titan's Gate (to the north) at (G-8). There is a second lever inside Titan's Gate to allow the 2nd person to come through too.

nodes.title: Go west until you come to Titan's Gate at (G-8).
nodes.description: Go west until you come to Titan's Gate at (G-8). Open the gate by clicking on it.

nodes.title: Continue north to a square area in the floor where you can drop down to the second map.
nodes.description: Continue north to a square area in the floor where you can drop down to the second map. (G-8)

nodes.title: Go east and trade the Purple Ribbon to the Hume Bones at (M-10), which will spawn the Lich C Magnus
nodes.description: Go east and trade the Purple Ribbon to the Hume Bones at (M-10), which will spawn the Lich C Magnus NM. Each quest member needs to trade their Purple Ribbon, kill the NM, and receive a Blue Ribbon. If someone else recently traded with the Hume Bones, you will get the message "You can't trade with it right now" and will need to wait a few minutes.

nodes.title: Check the Hume Bones after the NM has been defeated for a Blue Ribbon.
nodes.description: Check the Hume Bones after the NM has been defeated for a Blue Ribbon. If for some reason you are unable to obtain the Blue Ribbon and zone, you will need to start the quest over. Talk to Kerutoto and Roberta will give you the Purple Ribbon back again. You will need to bring it to Kerutoto to examine, then zone and talk to her again to get it back in order to do the fight.

nodes.title: Return to Kerutoto to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Kerutoto to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Speak with Leautiere at Bivouac # 2 (G-7/8) in Yahse Hunting Grounds to receive the quest.
nodes.description: Speak with Leautiere at Bivouac # 2 (G-7/8) in Yahse Hunting Grounds to receive the quest.

nodes.title: Examine the Magma Vein at (K-5) in Moh Gates to obtain a Magma survey report.
nodes.description: Examine the Magma Vein at (K-5) in Moh Gates to obtain a Magma survey report. You will likely have to bring people with you to clear the Knotted Roots in the way.

nodes.title: Return to Leautiere for reward.
nodes.description: Return to Leautiere for reward.

nodes.title: Trade Buffalostalker Dodzbraz, Uleguerand Range (F-9), two Cluster Cores to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade Buffalostalker Dodzbraz, Uleguerand Range (F-9), two Cluster Cores to complete the quest.

nodes.title: To start this quest, zone out from Castle Zvahl Keep (S) back to Castle Zvahl Baileys (S) for a cuts
nodes.description: To start this quest, zone out from Castle Zvahl Keep (S) back to Castle Zvahl Baileys (S) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: You have to zone out of the Castle Zvahl Keep (S) main entrance to get the cutscene.
nodes.description: You have to zone out of the Castle Zvahl Keep (S) main entrance to get the cutscene.

nodes.title: Zone back into Castle Zvahl Keep (S).
nodes.description: Zone back into Castle Zvahl Keep (S)

nodes.title: Head through the teleporters until you can access the room with the ??? at (Map 3, G-9) in Castle Zv
nodes.description: Head through the teleporters until you can access the room with the ??? at (Map 3, G-9) in Castle Zvahl Keep (S). Click on the ??? for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Then Drop down to kill the 4 Keep Imps located near the main teleporter then head back up through th
nodes.description: Then Drop down to kill the 4 Keep Imps located near the main teleporter then head back up through the teleporters to the ??? (G-9) to spawn the NM Gargouille Warden. Can be Slowed, but is very resistant to Paralyze If you die to the NM, you must kill the 4 imps again before you can respawn the NM. The cutscene at the ??? must be viewed before killing the Imps. Eliminating the Imps prior to viewing the cutscene will result in you needing to wait for them to respawn and eliminating them again.

nodes.title: After the Gargouille Warden is defeated, check the ??? again to get Zvahl passkey.
nodes.description: After the Gargouille Warden is defeated, check the ??? again to get Zvahl passkey. If you zoned before you obtain Zvahl passkey. You will need to kill the 4 imps to spawn Gargouille Warden and kill it again.

nodes.title: Go to the Throne Room (S) and check the Throne Room door to view a cutscene.
nodes.description: Go to the Throne Room (S) and check the Throne Room door to view a cutscene.

nodes.title: Check the Throne Room door again to enter the battlefield.
nodes.description: Check the Throne Room door again to enter the battlefield. Just like any BCNM every party member has to click the door to enter. If you fail the battlefield, the key item will no longer be in your possession, but you can immediately re-enter the battle without it. No zoning/key items required.

nodes.title: After the fight you will receive a cutscene and exit the battlefield at the Throne Room (S) zone.
nodes.description: After the fight you will receive a cutscene and exit the battlefield at the Throne Room (S) zone.

nodes.title: Return to Bastok Markets (S) and speak with Gentle Tiger (S) at (H-6/7) for the final cutscene.
nodes.description: Return to Bastok Markets (S) and speak with Gentle Tiger (S) at (H-6/7) for the final cutscene. After the cutscene ends you will receive your reward and be placed outside in North Gustaberg (S). Optional: Naji in present-day Metalworks will tell you of a hero from the Great War who received the special designation of Mythril Musketeer Zero. Optional: With the Bundle of half-inscribed scrolls, speak to Gentle Tiger (S) in Bastok Markets (S) (H-6) after completing the quest Bonds of Mythril for a cutscene and Trust: Klara.

nodes.title: Talk to Rholont in Southern San d'Oria (S) (E-7).
nodes.description: Talk to Rholont in Southern San d'Oria (S) (E-7). At the conclusion of the cutscene you will receive Letter to Count Aurchiat If you have a high-level White Mage, you can speed up the next two cutscenes by switching to it and casting Recall-Pashh and Recall-Jugner.

nodes.title: After receiving orders, go to Pashhow Marshlands (S) and head to the Shimmering Pondweed at (G-6) fo
nodes.description: After receiving orders, go to Pashhow Marshlands (S) and head to the Shimmering Pondweed at (G-6) for a cutscene. The quest will now be flagged in your log. Survival Guide warp to Rolanberry Fields (S) or Campaign warp to Pashhow Marshlands (S) is fastest.

nodes.title: Next you will be told to go to Jugner Forest (S).
nodes.description: Next you will be told to go to Jugner Forest (S). Head to (F-10) and inspect the Overgrown Mushrooms for a cutscene. You'll find them along the road as you move south and west. Campaign warp to Jugner Forest (S) is closest if you don't have Recall-Jugner. NOTE: Make sure your inventory is not full yet, because if you cannot receive the hatchet, you have to watch the entire CS again and cannot log the Key Item, even if you have your own hatchet.

nodes.title: Thereafter, use the Hatchet given to you on a Logging Point in the area to receive a Length of Jugne
nodes.description: Thereafter, use the Hatchet given to you on a Logging Point in the area to receive a Length of Jugner Ivy. (List of possible locations: Logging Map) It is recommended that you bring along an extra hatchet or two in case the hatchet that you are given breaks. The chance of getting the Length of Jugner Ivy from a logging point is high, but NOT 100%. A full inventory is recommended when logging for the Length of Jugner Ivy, as it allows you to keep using the same logging point until you get the key item. You do NOT need to get the CS from the Overgrown Mushrooms again even if you zone or logout.

nodes.title: Return to the Overgrown Mushrooms in Jugner Forest (S) for another cutscene.
nodes.description: Return to the Overgrown Mushrooms in Jugner Forest (S) for another cutscene.

nodes.title: Go to the lower right corner of (F-7) to check the Mossy Stump for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Go to the lower right corner of (F-7) to check the Mossy Stump for a cutscene.

nodes.title: After the cutscene, inspect the Mossy Stump again to enter a battlefield.
nodes.description: After the cutscene, inspect the Mossy Stump again to enter a battlefield. There is a battlefield time limit of 30 minutes. You may enter with a party of 6 people. Buffs are removed upon entry, excluding Food Effects. Trusts are dismissed upon entry but can be re-summoned inside. Experience is lost if you die. Reraise is lost upon being kicked from the battlefield. You must re-obtain the Length of Jugner Ivy if you fail the battlefield, but there isn't a 1 Vana'diel day restriction like other battlefields, you can obtain it immediately and try again. You do not need to check the Overgrown Mushrooms before or after re-obtaining the Length of Jugner Ivy. Everyone in the party must possess the Length of Jugner Ivy or have previously completed this quest to enter the battlefield.

nodes.title: The mission objective of this battlefield is to kill the Young Behemoth.
nodes.description: The mission objective of this battlefield is to kill the Young Behemoth. Roughly 18,000HP. Relatively weak hits, 10-30 shielded, 60-90 unshielded on a decently geared paladin. Has decent Accuracy; hit an Item Level NIN about 75% of the time. Has a strong Additional Effect: Lightning Damage effect on attacks, which seems to disappear when it uses Thunderbolt. Quite posibly a non elemental effect or not affected by magic resistance/ magic defense. 90-108 damage per activation with 0 Mdef and thunder resist, and 90-108 Damage per activation with +180 thunder resist & +20 Mdef. Frequently uses Thunderbolt which is aoe stun (used almost everytime after a blue magic spell was used on it). Frequently uses Shock Wave (cone attack that goes through shadows and has a mild knockback effect). Damage dependant on the number of times it uses Howl (varies 90~900). His TP move Howl seems to boost the damage dealt by Shock Wave. As the fight progresses the Young Behemoth will begin spamming Howl. It seems to have a cumulative effect (like stacking Boost) accounting for the increased damage dealt by Shock Wave. Dispel is recommended. Dispelling Howl had no effect on shockwave damage. Damage done, though, was related to the number of Howls used between each shockwave. Has somewhat high defense. Has very high evasion. (ACC food for melee a must). His evasion will not be an issue to an Item Level character. Has little to no MDB, nukes do full damage. The average Thunder IV did ~880 for 5% HP.

nodes.title: After you have won the Battlefield, you will receive another cutscene.
nodes.description: After you have won the Battlefield, you will receive another cutscene.

nodes.title: Afterward, report to Rongelouts N Distaud (S) (I-9) in Southern San d'Oria (S), and get your Reward.
nodes.description: Afterward, report to Rongelouts N Distaud (S) (I-9) in Southern San d'Oria (S), and get your Reward.

nodes.title: With the quest active, proceed to the Frontier Station at in either Foret de Hennetiel or Morimar Ba
nodes.description: With the quest active, proceed to the Frontier Station at in either Foret de Hennetiel or Morimar Basalt Fields and speak to the Station Worker there. You can simply use a Waypoint to teleport.

nodes.title: Upon talking to the Station Worker, you are prompted with a list of responses.
nodes.description: Upon talking to the Station Worker, you are prompted with a list of responses. You need to guess the right action from the right direction to raise their spirits. The correct action and direction changes after about five minutes and on day change; if you are fast, you can quickly repeat the quest using the same action/direction at a Station Worker in one of the zones for this quest. There is no limit on your number of guesses.

nodes.title: Correct Action: "As for your gag, it was right on the mark.".
nodes.description: Correct Action: "As for your gag, it was right on the mark."

nodes.title: Correct Direction: "Approaching from that direction was probably the right thing to do..".

nodes.description: {Southern San d'Oria (S)} (I-7) Talk to Raustigne at (I-7) (big gate at Victory Square) to trigger a cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to Rholont at (E-7) for cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Rholont at (E-7) for cutscene.

nodes.title: {Vunkerl Inlet (S)} (H-6) Examine a ??? on the north side of the bridge for a cutscene and Vunkerl H
nodes.description: {Vunkerl Inlet (S)} (H-6) Examine a ??? on the north side of the bridge for a cutscene and Vunkerl Herb Memo. The quest now appears in your log.

nodes.title: (F-5) At Ludiwa Spring, acquire Vunkerl Herb by examining Leafy Patch on the shore of the lake.
nodes.description: (F-5) At Ludiwa Spring, acquire Vunkerl Herb by examining Leafy Patch on the shore of the lake. You need to get the proper herb color according to the time of day that you arrive at the Leafy Patch. 00:00~07:59: red 08:00~15:59: blue 16:00~23:59: green You choose the color of the herb you wish to pick when you pick it, so you do not need to wait until a specific time. Just pick the herb that corresponds to the current time. It does not matter when you hand in the herb, as long as it was harvested at the proper time.

nodes.title: If you pick the wrong herb, you must go back to the Leafy Patch at (F-5) and pick a new herb.
nodes.description: If you pick the wrong herb, you must go back to the Leafy Patch at (F-5) and pick a new herb.

nodes.title: After you get the herb, return to the ??? at (H-6) for the final cutscene and a Carbon Fishing Rod.
nodes.description: After you get the herb, return to the ??? at (H-6) for the final cutscene and a Carbon Fishing Rod.

nodes.title: Choose to "warp to ???" during the previous quest's cutscene to enter Provenance.
nodes.description: Choose to "warp to ???" during the previous quest's cutscene to enter Provenance. If you chose not to warp, return to the glimmering ??? and choose the warp option.

nodes.title: The cutscene continues in Provenance and you are rewarded with a Clairvoy ant and access to Provenan
nodes.description: The cutscene continues in Provenance and you are rewarded with a Clairvoy ant and access to Provenance.

nodes.title: Talk to Horatius.
nodes.description: Talk to Horatius.

nodes.title: Obtain a Corsair's Testimony from Merrow Icedancers in Arrapago Reef or Lamia Fatedealers in Caedarv
nodes.description: Obtain a Corsair's Testimony from Merrow Icedancers in Arrapago Reef or Lamia Fatedealers in Caedarva Mire. Lamia Fatedealers respawn in 5 minutes, but Merrow Icedancers take 15 minutes to respawn. Two Lamia Fatedealers spawn near the Lamian Fang Key ??? in Caedarva Mire.

nodes.title: Examine the ??? at (H-10) in Arrapago Reef for a cutscene (the same ??? used in Luck of the Draw).
nodes.description: Examine the ??? at (H-10) in Arrapago Reef for a cutscene (the same ??? used in Luck of the Draw).

nodes.title: Trade the testimony to the ??? to be transported to Talacca Cove.
nodes.description: Trade the testimony to the ??? to be transported to Talacca Cove. Captain Qultada of the Seagull Phratrie

nodes.title: Once you are ready, trade the testimony to the Rock Slab in Talacca Cove to enter a battlefield agai
nodes.description: Once you are ready, trade the testimony to the Rock Slab in Talacca Cove to enter a battlefield against Qultada. Any buffs you have on you except Signet/Sanction/Sigil and food will be lost. You have 10 minutes as with any of the 70 Limit Break quests. If you fail, you can reattempt the fight using the same Corsair's Testimony two more times. After 3 uses, the testimony is lost. If you fail, you can simply walk to Talacca Cove. You do not need to return to the ??? in Arrapago Reef. If you have proceeded through Rhapsodies missions to the point of having Rhapsody in Umber Key Item then you can use Alter Egos

nodes.title: Captain Qultada seems to have 1550 HP.
nodes.description: Captain Qultada seems to have 1550 HP.

nodes.title: Opo-opo Necklace + Sleep Potions or Icarus Wings are useful to build TP for an opening Weapon Skill.
nodes.description: Opo-opo Necklace + Sleep Potions or Icarus Wings are useful to build TP for an opening Weapon Skill.

nodes.title: Qultada uses Phantom Roll, Quick Draw, and Wild Card.
nodes.description: Qultada uses Phantom Roll, Quick Draw, and Wild Card.

nodes.title: The best strategy is to use Quick Draw as often as possible and to build TP and use Slug Shot as oft
nodes.description: The best strategy is to use Quick Draw as often as possible and to build TP and use Slug Shot as often as possible. Hunter's Roll is a must due to Slug Shot's low accuracy.

nodes.title: Any level 99 job can easily solo this fight.
nodes.description: Any level 99 job can easily solo this fight.

nodes.title: Talk to Traiffeaux several times.
nodes.description: Talk to Traiffeaux several times. Select the first option 4 times, the second option, and then the first option.

nodes.title: He now asks for 3 Rabbit Hides and a Raaz Tusk.
nodes.description: He now asks for 3 Rabbit Hides and a Raaz Tusk. Raaz Tusks are dropped by the nearby Cicatricose Raaz and can also be purchased from the auction house. Rabbit Hides may be easier to obtain elsewhere if you are lower level. While they are obtainable in Kamihr Drifts, but the drop rate is extremely low and the rabbits are over level 113. If the level of the rabbits isn't an issue, the easiest method is likely to fight the (level 125) Serac Rabbits (with an almost 50% drop rate) just inside the Woh Gates entrance to the south of the Frontier Station. Rabbit Hides can also be purchased at the Tanner's Guild in Southern San d'Oria.

nodes.title: Collect the items and trade them to Traiffeaux to receive a Pair of fuzzy earmuffs and the "Fragment
nodes.description: Collect the items and trade them to Traiffeaux to receive a Pair of fuzzy earmuffs and the "Fragmenting" skill, allowing you damage Icy Palisades in Kamihr Drifts Reives. While it's not necessary to destroy Wintry Caves, the defending monsters seem to do way more damage to you if you haven't finished this quest. Requires testing.

nodes.description: Talk to Diegai (A) at (H/I-7) (Conflux #07).

nodes.description: Travel to (J-8) and talk with Baladanzo (A).

nodes.description: Optional: return to Diegai (A) and he will mention Bog Bodies.

nodes.description: Trade 10 Gunpowder Swathes dropped by Bog Bodies to Baladanzo (A) to complete the quest. These can be turned in to Baladanzo (A) one by one (without zoning) or all at once. Gunpowder Swathes are dropped by the Bog Bodies around (J-5) (Conflux #08). Gunpowder Swathe are stackable, but other items drop if you want to make inventory room.

nodes.description: Talk to Zazarg (A) at F-7 by Veridical Conflux 7 to flag the quest.

nodes.description: Defeat the NM Blanga (near Veridical Conflux 8). All members of the alliance who have flagged the quest will obtain an Imperial Pearl.

nodes.description: Return to Zazarg (A) for your reward.

nodes.description: Talk to Brugaire (L-6) to receive a Prismatic Elixir.

nodes.title: Use the Prismatic Elixir on Teekesselchen and defeat it.
nodes.description: Use the Prismatic Elixir on Teekesselchen and defeat it. Anyone that is on the quest may use an elixir on the same pop and still get credit for completing the quest. If you lose the elixir, you can get another from Brugaire any time. To pop Teekesselchen, trade a Bubbling Oil (from Sinister Seidel located around J-5) to the ??? in the middle of I-5.

nodes.title: Return to Brugaire after defeating Teekesselchen for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Brugaire after defeating Teekesselchen for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Brygid at K-9 in Bastok Markets.
nodes.description: Talk to Brygid at K-9 in Bastok Markets. She advises you to wear a Bronze Subligar and a Robe.

nodes.title: Obtain and equip these items.
nodes.description: Obtain and equip these items. This combination of equipment only can be worn by: BLU, BRD, DRK, MNK, RDM, DNC, COR, or THF.

nodes.title: Once you are wearing both items, speak with her to receive the Gloves to complete the set.
nodes.description: Once you are wearing both items, speak with her to receive the Gloves to complete the set.

nodes.title: Talk to Brygid while wearing any artifact armor piece (artifact +1 and artifact weapons do not work)
nodes.description: Talk to Brygid while wearing any artifact armor piece (artifact +1 and artifact weapons do not work). You only need to have one piece of AF armor on your body to trigger this quest.

nodes.title: Brygid will ask that you get a new body armor and leg armor to meet the demands of the fashion world
nodes.description: Brygid will ask that you get a new body armor and leg armor to meet the demands of the fashion world (she asks for armor equippable by your current job, with level requirements up to Level 60).

nodes.title: Recommend always starting the quest with her on the same job as you will see repeat requests for gea
nodes.description: Recommend always starting the quest with her on the same job as you will see repeat requests for gear, making the hunt for pieces much easier She does not accept +1 versions of armor. She does accept augmented normal-quality armor. You can change jobs to meet the requirements of the items she has requested even though you talked to her as a different job.

nodes.title: Speak to Brygid while wearing at least 1 piece of Empyrean Armor.
nodes.description: Speak to Brygid while wearing at least 1 piece of Empyrean Armor.

nodes.title: Brygid requests you wear certain body and leg equipment depending on the job you approach her as.
nodes.description: Brygid requests you wear certain body and leg equipment depending on the job you approach her as. Speak to her again while having both pieces equipped for your reward. If you are already wearing some of the possible gear for your current job that Brygid might select for you to wear, she will never select that gear, and will always suggest something else. Because of this, if you do not possess all of the possible equipment that Brygid might select for you to wear, it is recommended to unequip your body/legs armor prior to initiating the quest, to decrease the chances of Brygid selecting the equipment you do not have. Unlike previous quests, Brygid will accept both standard and HQ (+1) versions of gear. I.E. both a Orison Cap or a Orison Cap +1 will initiate the quest, and if she requests for you to wear a Scorpion Harness, a Scorpion Harness +1 will also fulfill the requirement. If you cannot find or obtain a piece of the equipment she asks for, you can talk to her again and she'll ask if you want to continue or quit. Electing to quit will remove the quest from your 'current' logs. You will have to rezone and talk to her again to redo/restart the quest, which will then randomize another pair of gear.

nodes.title: Talk to Foss and tell him you fish.
nodes.description: Talk to Foss and tell him you fish. He tells you that he will buy five rusty buckets from you.

nodes.title: These can be caught while fishing, or purchased from the auction house.
nodes.description: These can be caught while fishing, or purchased from the auction house.

nodes.title: Once you have five, trade them to him to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Once you have five, trade them to him to complete the quest.

nodes.description: As Ninja, talk to Ryoma (H-8) in Norg who will give you the Kodachi of Trials and the Weapon Training Guide (key item)

nodes.title: Use the Kodachi of Trials until the latent effect disappears.
nodes.description: Use the Kodachi of Trials until the latent effect disappears.

nodes.description: Talk to Gentle Tiger (S) at the entrance to Metalworks (H-6).

nodes.description: Talk to Engelhart at the entrance to the Music Shop in Bastok Markets (S) (K-10).

nodes.description: Head to The Eldieme Necropolis (S).

nodes.title: Drop in the MIDDLE (important!) pit in the southern room at (G-9) on map 1.
nodes.description: Drop in the MIDDLE (important!) pit in the southern room at (G-9) on map 1.

nodes.title: On map 2, head east to enter map 3.
nodes.description: On map 2, head east to enter map 3.

nodes.title: Walk to the northern room of (I-7).
nodes.description: Walk to the northern room of (I-7).

nodes.title: Examine the Sarcophagus in the northern room of (I-7) in The Eldieme Necropolis (S) on map 3 for a c
nodes.description: Examine the Sarcophagus in the northern room of (I-7) in The Eldieme Necropolis (S) on map 3 for a cutscene. The room is full of Orcs (sight aggro, approximately level 68~71). About 8 additional Orcs nearby can link with those in the Sarcophagus room, so caution is advised. Because the cutscene will drop aggro, you shouldn't need to worry about them so long as they don't kill you in the one second it takes to drop Invisible and click the Sarcophagus (extremely unlikely). Following the cut scene, be prepared to warp out or run up the hall and out of the zone.

nodes.title: Talk to Gentle Tiger (S) at the entrance to Metalworks (H-6) to complete the quest and obtain the ti
nodes.description: Talk to Gentle Tiger (S) at the entrance to Metalworks (H-6) to complete the quest and obtain the title Assistant Detective.

nodes.title: Talk to Blatherix at (F-8) in Bastok Markets (S) to obtain an Elixir.
nodes.description: Talk to Blatherix at (F-8) in Bastok Markets (S) to obtain an Elixir. While you don't need to do this to continue with Cait Sith (Mission), you will need to pick this up in order to continue this quest line later. Note:You may wish to hang onto this Elixir if progressing along the Bastok (S) quest line, as it will be needed later in The Truth Lies Hid. Otherwise you will need to re-buy it from the AH or a Curio Vendor Moogle.

nodes.title: Complete mission
nodes.description: Complete the mission: Butterfly-shaped key

nodes.title: Talk to Yocile to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Yocile to begin the quest. She is near the Statue of the Goddess (H-8) and Peacekeepers' Coalition (F-8) waypoints.

nodes.title: Trade her two Elshimo Coconuts to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade her two Elshimo Coconuts to complete the quest. The fastest way to obtain the Elshimo Coconuts is to purchase them from Ghemi Sinterilo in Kazham. The Kazham warp rune allows fast access. Ghemi Sinterilo is on the dock, on the same side as the Airship. She may be spoken to from the dock below, thus bypassing the 200 gil airship fee.

nodes.title: With your Main Job set to Dragoon, go to Cargo Room A in Port San d'Oria and talk to Arminibit or Ce
nodes.description: With your Main Job set to Dragoon, go to Cargo Room A in Port San d'Oria and talk to Arminibit or Ceraulian. Talking with either one will start the quest. It doesn't matter who you pick.

nodes.title: During the cut-scene, agree to help Ceraulian obtain a Gold Hairpin.
nodes.description: During the cut-scene, agree to help Ceraulian obtain a Gold Hairpin.

nodes.title: From this point on, you can change to any other job to complete the quest.
nodes.description: From this point on, you can change to any other job to complete the quest. Once you've flagged the quest, you don't need to be Dragoon to finish.

nodes.title: Trade a Gold Hairpin to Ceraulian for a cut-scene.
nodes.description: Trade a Gold Hairpin to Ceraulian for a cut-scene.

nodes.title: Wait 1 minute and talk to Ceraulian again for another cut-scene.
nodes.description: Wait 1 minute and talk to Ceraulian again for another cut-scene.

nodes.title: Go to Northern San d'Oria (E-6) and talk to Miaux, on the upper level in front of the Blacksmith's G
nodes.description: Go to Northern San d'Oria (E-6) and talk to Miaux, on the upper level in front of the Blacksmith's Guild shop for a cut-scene. She will give you the Shiny Earring

nodes.title: (Optional) You may now speak with Ceraulian for a clue to visit the Goldsmith's Guild.
nodes.description: (Optional) You may now speak with Ceraulian for a clue to visit the Goldsmith's Guild.

nodes.title: Got to Bastok Markets (H-8) at Home Point #4 and talk to Ardea in front of the Goldsmiths Guild.
nodes.description: Got to Bastok Markets (H-8) at Home Point #4 and talk to Ardea in front of the Goldsmiths Guild.

nodes.title: Make your way to West Ronfaure.
nodes.description: Make your way to West Ronfaure. Fastest way there is via the Northern San d'Oria Home Point (E) #1.

nodes.title: After arriving in West Ronfaure, go to the the tower at (F-6) and speak with Esca located inside for
nodes.description: After arriving in West Ronfaure, go to the the tower at (F-6) and speak with Esca located inside for a cut-scene. She will mention you must go to the small island in Batallia Downs, which can only be reached through The Eldieme Necropolis.

nodes.title: Go to The Eldieme Necropolis Fastest way is to return to Northern San d'Oria and use the Survival Gu
nodes.description: Go to The Eldieme Necropolis Fastest way is to return to Northern San d'Oria and use the Survival Guide next to the Home Point. If you don't have the Survival Guide teleport: Go to Batallia Downs (J-10) and locate the small cave on the side of the hill. Follow the tunnel into The Eldieme Necropolis.

nodes.title: Your goal in The Eldieme Necropolis is to get to the hole at (G-9; Point D on the map).
nodes.description: Your goal in The Eldieme Necropolis is to get to the hole at (G-9; Point D on the map). If you have acquired the Magicked astrolabe, then you can operate the gates solo. Otherwise, you will need at least one other person with you to operate the gates inside of The Eldieme Necropolis as follows.

nodes.title: Femitte needs a goldsmith to make a special earring for her, and not just any goldsmith will do.
nodes.description: Femitte needs a goldsmith to make a special earring for her, and not just any goldsmith will do. She gives you the Goldsmithing Order key item and specifically requests that you find an Elvaan goldsmith to complete this work. If you have already done "The Elvaan Goldsmith" you may recall Michea meets the requirements.

nodes.title: Talk to Norejaie in the Lion Springs Tavern Southern San d'Oria (K-6).
nodes.description: Talk to Norejaie in the Lion Springs Tavern Southern San d'Oria (K-6). She asks you to help with the extermination of a monster infesting Ordelle's Caves. If you cannot get the quest Norejaie will tell you either: Something about the food (Already completed Eco-Warrior this conquest period) "...Can I have a moment of your time? Oh, but you look busy..." (Eco-Warrior from another nation is logged)

nodes.title: Assemble a party or alliance.
nodes.description: Assemble a party or alliance. See notes below for preparation.

nodes.title: Go to Ordelle's Caves using the entrance at the south end of the ravine at La Theine Plateau (F-7).
nodes.description: Go to Ordelle's Caves using the entrance at the south end of the ravine at La Theine Plateau (F-7). The Atmacite Refiner's warp to Ordelle's Caves works well.

nodes.title: Once you're inside Ordelle's Caves, talk to Rojaireaut Ordelle's Caves, Map 2 (G-3) to have him appl
nodes.description: Once you're inside Ordelle's Caves, talk to Rojaireaut Ordelle's Caves, Map 2 (G-3) to have him apply the ointment. This caps your level at 25! Buffs do not wear off! So apply strong, lasting buffs before receiving the ointment! Trusts will be dismissed upon application of the level restriction, but can be resummoned (and will have the same level restriction that you do). Make sure everyone gets the ointment. If any alliance member does not receive it, then the monster will not spawn.

nodes.title: From Rojaireaut take the path to the left (head east, through the puddle) and take the long corridor
nodes.description: From Rojaireaut take the path to the left (head east, through the puddle) and take the long corridor. Use Circumspection from the Grounds Tome to receive sneak and invisible.

nodes.title: The ??? is located in the southwest corner of a small room on a stalagmite.
nodes.description: The ??? is located in the southwest corner of a small room on a stalagmite. The ??? is at Ordelle's Caves (G-9) , northeast corner. The designated tank/puller should spawn the NM Necroplasm by touching the ???. This ??? used to be at G-10. It was moved in a version update.

nodes.title: Defeat the Necroplasm.
nodes.description: Defeat the Necroplasm. For this fight, only those with the level cap can assist in this fight. Anyone else trying to help will receive a message telling them they cannot.

nodes.title: Examine the ??? to receive an Indigested Stalagmite.
nodes.description: Examine the ??? to receive an Indigested Stalagmite. After the battle, you may want to remove your level cap to cast Raise your friends so they can get the ???. To do this, you need to logout/Login. Upon logging in, your level cap is gone and you may Raise fallen friends.

nodes.title: Talk to Rojaireaut again! He will tell you to report to Norejaie.
nodes.description: Talk to Rojaireaut again! He will tell you to report to Norejaie. If you don't do this, you can still get the quest done but the gil/exp rewarded might be missing (depending on servers?).

nodes.title: Talk to Norejaie complete the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Norejaie complete the quest.

nodes.title: Repeatedly speak with Curilla (Chateau d'Oraguille) until she gives you an Old Pocket Watch.
nodes.description: Repeatedly speak with Curilla (Chateau d'Oraguille) until she gives you an Old Pocket Watch. You may need to talk to Curilla numerous times. If you have not taken The General's Secret, you will obtain it first. (You do not need to complete the quest to acquire this quest.) Note: After this point, this entire quest can be done as a job other than Red Mage if necessary.

nodes.title: Obtain a Velvet Cloth.
nodes.description: Obtain a Velvet Cloth.

nodes.title: Go to the basement of the Cathedral in Northern San d'Oria and speak with the priest, Pagisalis, who
nodes.description: Go to the basement of the Cathedral in Northern San d'Oria and speak with the priest, Pagisalis, who asks for Velvet Cloth. Trade the Velvet Cloth to him. Pagisalis can be found on the lower level of the Cathedral in the Reliquary. When you enter the Cathedral, immediately go to your left and on the right, just before the double doors in front of you there is a set of stairs that lead down. Go down these stairs and the first door on your left is the Reliquary.

nodes.title: When you pray, a cutscene activates and you receive some Old Boots.
nodes.description: When you pray, a cutscene activates and you receive some Old Boots.

nodes.title: Return to Curilla for a cutscene and to activate the next part of the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Curilla for a cutscene and to activate the next part of the quest. Speak to her until she specifically asks you to retrieve the Crawler Blood and bury it and the Old Boots in the nest.

nodes.title: Go to Crawlers' Nest and get a Nest Chest Key.
nodes.description: Go to Crawlers' Nest and get a Nest Chest Key. Then find a treasure chest (click for maps: or ) and open it with the key, and this will give you the Crawler Blood. This can be done on any job once you have flagged the quest. CAUTION: Opening this chest aggroes the monsters around you if you are not a high enough level, even if you have Sneak active (Sneak drops upon opening the chest). NOTE!: With Rhapsody in White you can buy a Nest Chest Key for 2,500gil from Curio Vendor Moogle.

nodes.title: Talk to Rondipur in Northern San d'Oria to activate the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Rondipur in Northern San d'Oria to activate the quest.

nodes.title: Zone into The Eldieme Necropolis from Batallia Downs (I-10) (Entrance 1).
nodes.description: Zone into The Eldieme Necropolis from Batallia Downs (I-10) (Entrance 1). The fastest way there is using the survival guide located just inside. If you use this, you must zone out and back in to activate the quest.

nodes.title: The first person to zone into the dungeon will get a cut scene with Cannau about the quest.
nodes.description: The first person to zone into the dungeon will get a cut scene with Cannau about the quest.

nodes.title: That person must talk to Cannau to start the quest.
nodes.description: That person must talk to Cannau to start the quest. You will have 30 minutes to finish from this point. If noone talks to her, after several minutes she will leave.

nodes.title: After talking to Cannau, she will immediately bolt away and start towards her destination with no th
nodes.description: After talking to Cannau, she will immediately bolt away and start towards her destination with no thought for aggro at all. Anyone can stop and start her, simply talk to her; she will reply "Why have we stopped?." This way you can safely fight mobs with her out of aggro and AoE range. To start her moving again, talk to her once more. Make sure you give the order to stop well in advance of where you actually want her to stop...due to lag she will sometimes take a few steps before she responds, and thus aggro unintentionally.

nodes.title: If Cannau's HP gets low (in the yellow) she will draw hate from the undead at a distance; Cannau can
nodes.description: If Cannau's HP gets low (in the yellow) she will draw hate from the undead at a distance; Cannau can be cured.

nodes.title: She will wind her way to the switch at (H-8) to open the doors.
nodes.description: She will wind her way to the switch at (H-8) to open the doors.

nodes.title: After throwing the switch, she will go one of the two ways that you can continue on to the west (the
nodes.description: After throwing the switch, she will go one of the two ways that you can continue on to the west (the ultimate goal is the room at (F-8).

nodes.title: Once she gets to the eastern or western wall of the room at (F-8), she will stop.
nodes.description: Once she gets to the eastern or western wall of the room at (F-8), she will stop. Talking to her will get you a Completion Certificate. You have about 20 seconds to talk to the escortee before she warps out.

nodes.title: Go back to Rondipur in Northern San d'Oria to receive your Page from Miratete's Memoirs and 10,000g
nodes.description: Go back to Rondipur in Northern San d'Oria to receive your Page from Miratete's Memoirs and 10,000g if it's your first completion.

nodes.title: Talk to Aurege, he and Guilberdrier discuss one of their workers who is gambling again and late for
nodes.description: Talk to Aurege, he and Guilberdrier discuss one of their workers who is gambling again and late for work.

nodes.title: Talk to Varchet in Southern San d'Oria (L-6), the missing worker.
nodes.description: Talk to Varchet in Southern San d'Oria (L-6), the missing worker. He will agree to go back to work only if you win against him gambling. Bet 5 gil until you win against him (it may take several tries), then he says he will return to work.

nodes.title: Talk to Aurege again to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Aurege again to complete the quest.

nodes.title: You can still gamble with Varchet after the quest is over.
nodes.description: You can still gamble with Varchet after the quest is over. It will be a bet of 5 gil, with the winner getting 10 gil.

nodes.title: Talk to Ailbeche, a small crying boy just south of the fountain, to get a cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Ailbeche, a small crying boy just south of the fountain, to get a cutscene. He says he became separated with his father, and doesn't know what to do. You must look for someone in armor but no helmet.

nodes.title: Talk to Ailbeche's father, Exoroche, shopping in Southern San d'Oria in Helbort's Blades.
nodes.description: Talk to Ailbeche's father, Exoroche, shopping in Southern San d'Oria in Helbort's Blades.

nodes.title: Talk to Ailbeche again to get another cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Ailbeche again to get another cutscene. His father appears and scolds him for crying and turning to strangers for help. As punishment, he takes the boy's fishing rod away and gives it to you. This completes the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Secodiand; he needs 2 bat wings to create wards.
nodes.description: Talk to Secodiand; he needs 2 bat wings to create wards.

nodes.title: Obtain the wings and trade them to him to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Obtain the wings and trade them to him to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Halver for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Halver for a cutscene. He will ask you to find a female adventurer that fits Prince Trion's preferences. Halver is involved with many quests. You may need to speak to him several times.

nodes.title: Consult the table below to pinpoint the player model you need to find.
nodes.description: Consult the table below to pinpoint the player model you need to find. Have a matching player in your party and in the zone, then talk to Halver again. You may cancel the quest at any time. You can restart the quest every in-game hour with no need to zone, and Halver will give you a new description. If you are female, Halver will never describe an adventurer with your race. Some race/face combinations are very common, and some are very rare. These will be indicated by gold and gray boxes in the table, respectively.

nodes.title: You will be rewarded with Castor's Ring and the title "Royal Wedding Planner".
nodes.description: You will be rewarded with Castor's Ring and the title "Royal Wedding Planner". Your partner will be rewarded with Pollux's Ring and the title "Consort Candidate". The quality on these rings can be removed by synthing them with a Wind Crystal, and they can be signed by using a Cyclone Crystal. These synths have a 100% success rate.

nodes.title: Talk to Rugiette or Regine in the magic shop.
nodes.description: Talk to Rugiette or Regine in the magic shop. They talk about the lack of floor traffic. After this, when you talk to Regine and she asks how she can help you, you'll have the option to say you're looking for work. Choose it, and Regine gives you some flyers to hand out to boost business. You get 15 flyers and must trade them all to various people in the San d'Oria, but very few will actually take them. An indication that a NPC will accept the flyer is by a system message stating "NPCname looks over curiously for a moment." when you approach that specific NPC. You must have two inventory slots free, as you will receive 1 stack (12) and 3 flyers. If you need more flyers, go back to Regine and trade her 10 gil per flyer. You can't trade Regine 150 gil for 15 flyers, you must continuously trade her 10 gil per flyer and then sort them into your inventory. You may also find them at the Auction House.

nodes.title: Trade the flyers to NPC's until you have given away all 15.
nodes.description: Trade the flyers to NPC's until you have given away all 15.

nodes.title: Talk to Regine again to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Regine again to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Ramua and agree to help her to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Ramua and agree to help her to start the quest.

nodes.title: You need to sign up with the Carpenters' Guild for this quest to be activated.
nodes.description: You need to sign up with the Carpenters' Guild for this quest to be activated.

nodes.title: Ramua will hand you both a hatchet & Timber Survey Checklist upon accepting.
nodes.description: Ramua will hand you both a hatchet & Timber Survey Checklist upon accepting. It is advised to buy more hatchets as they do break on occasion.

nodes.title: Head to Jugner Forest and locate Logging Points on which to use your Hatchet.
nodes.description: Head to Jugner Forest and locate Logging Points on which to use your Hatchet. The Timber Survey Checklist that Ramua gave you lists five logs. You must obtain one of each (Arrowwood Log, Ash Log, Yew Log, Willow Log, and Walnut Log). It is completely random what logs or other items you will obtain from Logging. It is possible to get multiples of the same log from a Logging Point. You cannot purchase the logs and trade them to Ramua. She will refuse to take them. They must be logged by you and you will see a message pertaining to that. While you must actually log at least one of each type of log to complete this quest, the logs traded to the NPC can be purchased if you no longer have the original logs. When you successfully cut off a log for the first time of a kind you need, you will see the message: "<Your name> recorded survey data for a <log name> on the Timber Survey Checklist." Subsequent logging of a log you've already recorded does nothing extra.

nodes.title: Return to Ramua and trade her your five logs to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Ramua and trade her your five logs to complete the quest. Ramua will confirm the logs and allow you to keep them.

nodes.title: Talk to Olbergieut, in the Manuscript room of the Northern San d'Oria Cathedral.
nodes.description: Talk to Olbergieut, in the Manuscript room of the Northern San d'Oria Cathedral. He asks you to take a Key Item:Scripture of Wind to Faurbellant.

nodes.title: Go to La Theine Plateau, and find Faurbellant located at the east wall of the Crag of Holla (K-8).
nodes.description: Go to La Theine Plateau, and find Faurbellant located at the east wall of the Crag of Holla (K-8).

nodes.title: Talk to Faurbellant.
nodes.description: Talk to Faurbellant. He will give you a Key Item:Scripture of Water.

nodes.title: Return to the Cathedral in Northern San d'Oria, and talk to Olbergieut for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to the Cathedral in Northern San d'Oria, and talk to Olbergieut for your reward.

nodes.title: Speak to Andecia.
nodes.description: Speak to Andecia. She wants you to replace the offering water at the King's tomb. Speak to her again to receive the Well Water. If you drop the Well Water, you will be asked to retrieve the Tomb Waterskin from the grave, fill it at the well in Southern San d'Oria (F-6), then go back to the tomb to leave the water.

nodes.title: Go to King Ranperre's Tomb and find the tombstone at the center of the maze at (I-10) on the first m
nodes.description: Go to King Ranperre's Tomb and find the tombstone at the center of the maze at (I-10) on the first map. Monsters in the tomb aggro up to level 14. Also undead are around the tomb at night so take precautions.

nodes.title: Trade the Well Water to the tombstone to receive the Tomb Waterskin.
nodes.description: Trade the Well Water to the tombstone to receive the Tomb Waterskin.

nodes.title: Return to Andecia and trade her the Tomb Waterskin for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Andecia and trade her the Tomb Waterskin for your reward.

nodes.title: Maugie wants you to clean off the signposts in Jugner Forest.
nodes.description: Maugie wants you to clean off the signposts in Jugner Forest.

nodes.title: There are 4 signposts in Jugner Forest, located at (E-11), (G-8), (H-7), and (J-5).
nodes.description: There are 4 signposts in Jugner Forest, located at (E-11), (G-8), (H-7), and (J-5). To clean them, just click on them, read the garbled message, then choose to clean it when given the option.

nodes.title: Talk to Kuu Mohzolhi; she's obsessed with flowers and will tell you about gardening.
nodes.description: Talk to Kuu Mohzolhi; she's obsessed with flowers and will tell you about gardening. She doesn't ask for help but she'd like to have flowers to plant in her garden. (Optional) Trade a flower to her and she'll mention Chalvatot who likes carnations, but what she really wants is a Marguerite.

nodes.title: Obtain a Marguerite and trade it to her to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Obtain a Marguerite and trade it to her to complete the quest.

nodes.title: {Northern San d'Oria} Upstairs in Cathedral you will find Eperdur.
nodes.description: {Northern San d'Oria} Upstairs in Cathedral you will find Eperdur. He will tell you that there is word of a foul wind coming from Gusgen Mines that is blowing on the Crag of Dem in Konschtat Highlands. The seal that stops the dead from walking is weakening. Eperdur gives you key item: Seal of Banishing.

nodes.title: {Gusgen Mines} Go straight and down some stairs until you get to the first set of three levers.
nodes.description: {Gusgen Mines} Go straight and down some stairs until you get to the first set of three levers. Pull the center one. Continue on north ahead and down a second set of stairs until you get to the second set of levers. Pull the west-most lever. Simply hug the left-hand wall until you come to a hole in the ground Gusgen Mines, Map 3 (F-8). Cast Invisible or use your Prism Powder BEFORE dropping down the hole - it contains bombs, which aggro sight and magic. Do not forget to cast Sneak or use a Silent Oil! The flies down the hole aggro sound. Take particular note of a NM that pops once a day directly beneath the hole: Juggler Hecatomb. The ??? is behind the shed to the southwest, located in Gusgen Mines, Map 4 (G-8). Deactivate Invis when nothing is looking your way, check the ???, and warp out. NOTE: There are 2 sets of ??? in this room, pay attention to the location AND Make sure that you get the message: "You have found the location of the seal. You place a Seal of Banishing on it." after examining the ???. If you re-examine the ???, you will get the message: "A Seal of Banishing is on this seal." If you do NOT get these messages, you haven't found the right ???. Everything in this dungeon detects by sound except for the bombs at the end, which detect by sight and magic. Level 50 and above will not get aggro from normal mobs.

nodes.title: {Northern San d'Oria} Return to Eperdur for your reward.
nodes.description: {Northern San d'Oria} Return to Eperdur for your reward.

nodes.title: Enter Chateau d'Oraguille and go to the Queen Leaute Memorial Garden (F-7).
nodes.description: Enter Chateau d'Oraguille and go to the Queen Leaute Memorial Garden (F-7).

nodes.title: Talk to Chalvatot, who is nearby.
nodes.description: Talk to Chalvatot, who is nearby. He will seem upset and not willing to help if you are not of the San d'Oria allegiance.

nodes.title: Talk to Chalvatot again and receive a cutscene(if you do not get the cutscene you must zone out of C
nodes.description: Talk to Chalvatot again and receive a cutscene(if you do not get the cutscene you must zone out of Chateau d'Oraguille and back in.) Accept the Quest. Default Selection is No, so make sure you're not spamming enter to skip through the dialogue.

nodes.title: Trade Chalvatot a Derfland Humus to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade Chalvatot a Derfland Humus to complete the quest. Derfland Humus drops from Doom Scorpions in Crawler's Nest and can be bought and sold at the Auction House

nodes.title: After another cutscene, you will receive Map of the Northlands Area, 2,000 gil and 2,000 Experience
nodes.description: After another cutscene, you will receive Map of the Northlands Area, 2,000 gil and 2,000 Experience Points. If you have already obtained the map you will still receive 2,000 gil and XP.

nodes.title: Talk to Vilatroire in the Watchtower, accessed from Northern San d'Oria (C-7).
nodes.description: Talk to Vilatroire in the Watchtower, accessed from Northern San d'Oria (C-7).

nodes.title: Form a party of 2 people of the same race, then talk to him again to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Form a party of 2 people of the same race, then talk to him again to complete the quest. All party members must be in the Watchtower area.

nodes.title: Talk to Vilatroire in the Watchtower, accessed from Northern San d'Oria (C-7).
nodes.description: Talk to Vilatroire in the Watchtower, accessed from Northern San d'Oria (C-7).

nodes.title: Form a party of 2 people from the same nation, then talk to him again to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Form a party of 2 people from the same nation, then talk to him again to complete the quest. All party members must be in the Watchtower area.

nodes.title: You MUST complete the previous quest Chasing Quotas, before Rahal will allow you to flag this quest.
nodes.description: You MUST complete the previous quest Chasing Quotas, before Rahal will allow you to flag this quest.

nodes.title: Speak with Rahal in Chateau d'Oraguille (H-9) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Speak with Rahal in Chateau d'Oraguille (H-9) for a cutscene. Rahal is in the Royal Knights' Quarters (to the left after you enter the Chateau). You must be Dragoon to flag the quest. Make sure you choose the first option at the end of the cutscene. If you didn't, talk to him again to choose the right option.

nodes.title: Hanaa needs your help again.
nodes.description: Hanaa needs your help again. Fetch her 3 Lizard Skins and she'll make you something nice.

nodes.title: Talk to Nogelle; she needs 3 Lufet Salts for her bean surprise and hints you might get it from river
nodes.description: Talk to Nogelle; she needs 3 Lufet Salts for her bean surprise and hints you might get it from river crabs.

nodes.title: Obtain the Lufet Salt by defeating River Crabs in West Ronfaure at the Knightwell.
nodes.description: Obtain the Lufet Salt by defeating River Crabs in West Ronfaure at the Knightwell. You cannot buy it as it is an Exclusive item. Note: Get 5 Lufet Salts if you plan on continuing with the next quest.

nodes.title: Trade 3 salts to Nogelle to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade 3 salts to Nogelle to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Note that Rank 2 for San d'Orians or advancement to Mission 2-3 for Windurstians and Bastokers is re
nodes.description: Note that Rank 2 for San d'Orians or advancement to Mission 2-3 for Windurstians and Bastokers is required to enter the Chateau d'Oraguille. 5 of the NPCs for Lure of the Wildcat quest are there, and thus access to it is required to get the Mythril piece as a reward.<- Meaning the imperial Mythril piece you get from Naja Salaheem (Aht Urhgan Whitegate (I-10); upstairs)) for trading her all 4 invitation cards you get for doing all 4 Wildcat quests.

nodes.title: Note: The quest A Timely Visit will also give you access to Chateau d'Oraguille when you reach the p
nodes.description: Note: The quest A Timely Visit will also give you access to Chateau d'Oraguille when you reach the point where you are ordered to talk to Halver.

nodes.title: As WHM, Talk to Narcheral (M-6) in the cathedral, on the balcony that overlooks the main floor, in N
nodes.description: As WHM, Talk to Narcheral (M-6) in the cathedral, on the balcony that overlooks the main floor, in Northern San d'Oria.

nodes.title: After flagging it, you can complete the remainder of the quest on any job.
nodes.description: After flagging it, you can complete the remainder of the quest on any job.

nodes.title: Head to Valkurm Dunes around (B-8).
nodes.description: Head to Valkurm Dunes around (B-8). This is the secret beach area. The Gustav Tunnel Survival Guide is the fastest way there.

nodes.title: Wait until night (18:00 game time) and a ??? will appear near the Song Runes.
nodes.description: Wait until night (18:00 game time) and a ??? will appear near the Song Runes. Click on the ??? to spawn the NM Shadow Marchelute. The ??? will depop at 5:00 Vana'diel time.

nodes.title: Defeat Marchelute, and it will drop a Tavnazia Pass.
nodes.description: Defeat Marchelute, and it will drop a Tavnazia Pass.

nodes.title: Trade the pass to Narcheral to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade the pass to Narcheral to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Balasiel in Southern San d'Oria who will give you the Spear of Trials and the Weapon Trainin
nodes.description: Talk to Balasiel in Southern San d'Oria who will give you the Spear of Trials and the Weapon Training Guide. If you chose the the wrong answer by mistake, zone out and back in to get the cutscene again.

nodes.title: Perform Weapon Skills with the Spear of Trials until the latent effect disappears.
nodes.description: Perform Weapon Skills with the Spear of Trials until the latent effect disappears. To remove the latent effect, you must acquire 300 Weapon Skill Points. You receive 5 points for opening/soloing a weaponskill, 7 points for closing a Lv.1 Skillchain, 9 points for closing a Lv.2 Skillchain and 11 points for closing a level 3 Skillchain. See the Skillchain Chart for more details.

nodes.title: You must perform Weapon Skills and Skillchains on monsters that directly grant experience points to
nodes.description: You must perform Weapon Skills and Skillchains on monsters that directly grant experience points to you. You CANNOT acquire points from Weapon Skills performed during Campaign Battles or Besieged.

nodes.title: Weapon Skills performed while under Level Sync count.
nodes.description: Weapon Skills performed while under Level Sync count.

nodes.title: Weapon Skills performed in Reives will count.
nodes.description: Weapon Skills performed in Reives will count.

nodes.title: It is not necessary to remove the weapon in order to see when the latent effect is removed.
nodes.description: It is not necessary to remove the weapon in order to see when the latent effect is removed.

nodes.title: Once you no longer receive the latent effect bonus, head back to Southern San d'Oria and trade the S
nodes.description: Once you no longer receive the latent effect bonus, head back to Southern San d'Oria and trade the Spear of Trials back to Balasiel, who will take the weapon from you and give you a Map to the Annals of Truth and tell you to head to Sea Serpent Grotto. (Note: The latent effect will not always be removed once you hit the 300 Weaponskill points; to check your progress if unsure trade the weapon back to Balasiel.)

nodes.title: You need to get a Sahagin Key from the Sahagin Key Quest.
nodes.description: You need to get a Sahagin Key from the Sahagin Key Quest. When everyone is ready, trade the Sahagin Key to the Ornamented door at (J-10/11). You cannot open it from inside and you lose the key, so make sure everyone gets in together. Pass the bridge into the next room.

nodes.title: Click the ??? to spawn the NM Water Leaper.
nodes.description: Click the ??? to spawn the NM Water Leaper.

nodes.title: Once the NM is dead, reexamine the ??? to obtain the Annals of Truth.
nodes.description: Once the NM is dead, reexamine the ??? to obtain the Annals of Truth.

nodes.title: Bring this back to Balasiel for your reward.
nodes.description: Bring this back to Balasiel for your reward.

nodes.title: NOTE: You cannot unlock this quest if you already have another WSNM quest active, though you CAN can
nodes.description: NOTE: You cannot unlock this quest if you already have another WSNM quest active, though you CAN cancel the quest by talking to the NPC that gave it to you.

nodes.title: Talk to Curilla in Chateau d'Oraguille to obtain a Sapara of Trials and a Weapon Training Guide.
nodes.description: Talk to Curilla in Chateau d'Oraguille to obtain a Sapara of Trials and a Weapon Training Guide. If you are participating in the Trust Initiative to obtaining Alter Egos, this will prioritize over the weapon skill quest.
